Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Janaan Darrow
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the described features - regular batteries, HD movies as easy as pressing a button, the extra small eye for glare-free steady focus.  To supplement my camera, I ordered a 16GB memory card, the recommended case, the 2-year protection plan and after a little research, the designated USB cable: Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS USB Cable - USB Computer Cord for PowerShot SD1400 IS (which with shipping cost $10.74). After trying it out on a skiing trip I was pleased with the fast shooting, the long battery life, true colors and textures. Awesome camera!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA - Don't Believe the nasayers
Reviews.Author: DENNIS E EBERSOLD
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great little economical camera this is it.  Love the AA Battery feature...no charger to take along on trips. You can buy backup batteries almost anywhere.  For a AA camera it has a long battery life.  I am using rechargables I bought on Amazon. The complaint about the plastic camera body made me laugh.  My $1200.00 Olympus Mr Bulky is all plastic so is the interior on my $40,000.00 Pickup. So why expect more from a $100.00 camera. The only comlaint is that the SD card is in the same compartment as the AA batteries. Not a deal breaker for me, but kind of inconvenient.  Photos are excellent, sharp bright colors.  I didn't buy this for the video feature however it has better sound quality than my wifes $500.00 camcorder.  I was amazed. Love the telephoto viewfinder feature. If you are looking for an economical, take along camera that does a decent job this is it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: John Orban
Reviews.Content: I bought four of these (prior version) cameras for school and one for the school auction/dance (auctioned off with 4 hours of my time for photo instruction, etc.).Anyhow - I LOVE these cameras. AA batts so I don't have to worry about whether the camera is charged or not. (I have a PowerShot SX210 with two lithium batts, personally. But for school, recharging batts is no good - the cameras might sit on the shelf for a while and lose charge and I don't want to buy extra $60 batts for them.)So...kids use them, mostly, to shoot videos. Being able to take the SCCard out of the camera and put it into a small SD Card reader is just so easy. Forget about the USB cable. Most laptops now come with SD slots in them so you can pop the card out of the camera and into your laptop - how much easier is that??I think this is an EXCELLENT --> ENTRY LEVEL <-- camera for kids, particularly; but, really, anyone who wants to start learning about photography. Yeah, it lacks a lot of bells and whistles a lot of the other P&S; cameras have, but that's GREAT because there is nothing to distract you from learning how to "see" a good photo and learn all about the "photographer's eye".I've also felt that it's good not having too much stuff on a device because then you can really learn what you are missing and KNOW what to look for when you're ready to move up to the next level.I think a lot of folks "overbuy" in a camera, especially, and then either get frustrated with it because there just is too much to learn or, worse, just don't use the camera.The price is right - the camera is more than capable of taking great photos. I plan to buy some more for the school.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Dan J
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that had the following criteria:Universal AA or AAA batteries (not proprietary Li-ion or other technologies), HD Video recordingLightweight, "easy to use" and not that many buttons, and inexpensiveThis camera meets my criteria.(1) Here's a further explanation of the battery issue:The problem with Li-ion batteries is that once a manufacture changes the battery pack and no longer makes the battery it becomes hard to find. Li-ion batteries have a shelf life of about 2 years (from the data of manufacture) & if they haven't been charged in that time frame, they will not last very long. Once they are fully discharged they may not "recover". You could end up buying a new battery pack and only getting at best 4-6 shots before needing a recharge.The Canon A1400 uses 2 AA batteries. My preference is two use Sanyo (now Panasonic) Eneloop NiMH (Nickel Metal Hydride) Rechargeable batteries. I have over 5 years of experience using these throughout the household. They can be recharged from 1500 to 1800 times (depends on the series) and can hold up to 90% of their charge for up to a year. I carry two in the camera and two as spares in a compact camera case (Case Logic DBC-302 purchased here on Amazon as an "add-on" purchase and therefore discounted).With Alkaline batteries you can take up to 150 (screen on), 200 (ECO mode), or 500 (screen off) still shots (less if you use flash and/or zoom a-lot or playback (review) shots. With NiMH rechargeable, the number of shots increase to 500 (screen on), 600 (ECO mode) or up to 1100 (screen off). In Screen off mode, you use the built-in viewfinder - which is becoming increasingly difficult to find in an "entry-level" camera.(2) You can quickly change the default picture size from 16MP (default) to 8MP, 2MP, 0.3MP (VGA) or Widescreen using the "Func./Set" button on the back of the camera.(3) The camera includes digital (not optical) image stabilization (IS) which is better than nothing. For still images without a tripod or slow moving scenes, it works fairly well. For fast action scenes, the camera takes 3 shots and then chooses the best one to use. Again for the price you pay it would be hard to find a point and shoot camera that uses optical image stabilization.(4) You can record (make) movies in 720p resolution. This was another reason that I wanted this camera. I have a larger DSLR (Olympus E-620) and 5 lenses to go with it that is great for shooting a lot of different kinds of pictures (close-up, far away or fast action), but it does not have the ability to record (make) a movie. So this camera fills a void and does so at a nice price point. It's a good daily or spur of the moment camera.(5) I wish it came with a printed manual, a USB cable and at least a 1 or 2 GB SD card but it came with none of these items. It does come with a wrist strap and a pair of alkaline batteries. Fortunately, I was able to download the manual and use a 2 GB (class 4) & 16 GB (class 10) SD card that I had laying around at home. It works well with either density or speed.(6) Although it does not come with software, you can download some free software at the Canon website that allows you to import pictures from the camera with a USB cable or through a USB card reader to:  Manage/Print the images, and Edit the pictures as follows:(a) Correct Red-eye,(b) Auto Correct,(c) Adjust color and Brightness,(d) Increase Sharpness,(e) Crop Image,(f) Insert Text,(g) Stitch photos (to create a panoramic photo),(h) Edit Movies, and(i) Extract Multiple images from Movie (this feature alone makes the "free" software worthy enough of a download/install.The software works on Windows (from 95 to 8.1), Mac OS 8 to OS X 10.9, and Linux (something for everyone).To get the software, go to the Canon website, click on Support, pick a region of the world and then a country, then "Consumer & Home office", then "Powershot cameras", then "Powershot A series", and finally scroll down & select the "Powershot A1400" camera. Once there, you'll be able to download the user manuals, guides and/or brochures as well as the software.On balance this is a great entry level camera with a lot of useful bells and whistles (features). I recommend that you download one or both of the searchable PDF manuals. It takes decent pictures & easily slips into your pocket (but I prefer to use a compact camera case more for protection than anything else). It comes with a wrist strap, a pair of alkaline AA batteries and a 1 year warranty. Its a camera for all ages.Like anything, the more you use the camera in different settings & modes the better you get at using it. The "auto" mode is nice when there is plenty of light, it's also a great learning tool as you get to see what the camera chose on your behalf. You can also turn off the digital zoom and rely only on the 5x optical zoom.If you find that you need more flash "light" (something that extends the flash range up to 30 feet), look at the Canon HF-DC1 that sells for around $52 here on Amazon. It's triggered by the built-in flash (recall that light travels pretty fast) and can come in handy.As with every camera product, you can spend more money and get something better but at every price point you can make that decision. For me the last criteria is that the camera was inexpensive and this camera also meets that criteria. Good luck with your search & or purchase.UPDATED 04-26-2014This camera uses a 32-bit image processor that has a 4 GB file size limit, so when you are shooting video's (movie) continuously the camera will stop after the 4 GB file size is reached.In HD Quality 1280 x 720p (25 fps - frames per second), the length of the movie is around 27:18.In SD Quality  480 x 640p (30 fps - frames per second), the length of the movie is around 50:10.Note this limit is not just a Canon limit rather most cameras have this limit unless they are using a 64-bit processor. It's generally not an issue with most people, myself included as I generally take video's from 5 seconds to 15-20 minutes.When I try & compose a close up shot, I will sometimes switch to movie mode and make a 3-5 second video clip, then use the free software that you can download and extract stills (photo's) from the video clip & I am bound to find one that I like a lot.This is an awesome camera for the money.UPDATED 05-26-2014I purchased a 2nd A1400 because I like the first one so much and wanted to have a backup.I've used the camera in very low light settings, taking pictures and video clips of "Disney On Ice" in a box seat some 100-200 feet away from the skaters. The booth like the arena was dimly lit: wall sconces, step lights and exit signs provide what little light there was for safety reasons. The only other lights were above the skaters where spot/flood lights of varying colors lit up parts of the arena. The camera has a 5.0x optical zoom (shows up in white) and an additional 4x of digital zoom (shows up in blue). I set the camera for 5.0x optical and would take photos that turned out nicely, but for the most part I shot video clips. When shooting video you have no additional optical zoom except for what you initially set the camera with. Any more zoom is digital (which is akin to cropping the image). Still I was able to get very nice video clips. When I got home, I used the free ImageBrowserEX software that you can download from Canon here: www.usa.canon.com/cusa/support/consumer/digital_cameras/powershot_a_series/powershot_a1400#DriversAndSoftware and extracted extracted stills (photos) from the video clips. Incidentally this method works great when trying to take pictures of kids running around. You can extract up to 25 photos per second in HD 1280 x 720p mode, from the video clips and you are bound to find many that you will like.It's best if you can to read the manual to take full advantage of all the bell's and whistles that the camera has to offer. You can find the manual here: gdlp01.c-wss.com/gds/0/0300010040/01/ps-a1400-a2600-cu-en.pdfYou have to supply your own SD card (Class 6 or higher, and densities up to 32 GB). I use a 16 GB Class 10 SD card.You can transfer the photo's to the computer via a standard Type A male USB to Type B male mini USB cable or via the SD card itself. If your computer lacks an SD Card reader, you can use one like this: http://www.amazon.com/IOGEAR-MicroSD-Reader-Writer-GFR204SD/dp/B0046TJG1U/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_to which sells for $5.95 here on Amazon.The recommend case, Case Logic DCB-302 which sells for $5.99 here on Amazon http://www.amazon.com/Case-Logic-DCB-302-Compact-Camera/dp/B003F7DWH8/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top protects the camera nicely in the main zippered pouch and with the front zippered pouch can store from 4-6 additional batteries, a couple of SD cards and the SD to USB adapter with room for a few more things.I have been using Sanyo Eneloop NiMH rechargeable batteries for more than 5 years and have no complaints. I use a pair in the Canon A1400 camera and carry 4 in the camera case. They recharge in pairs in about 7 hours and come with charger in the 4-pack which sells for under $25 here on Amazon. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004SB1TD4/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1This is an awesome camera and value for the money.

Reviews.Title: The only point and shot pocket camera with a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Rob Reppert
Reviews.Content: Being able to use the view finder and turning off the back screen saves batteries.  If you do need to change batteries this camera uses standard AAs that are available everywhere.  The 5x zoom is great and more adaptable than a phone or tablet camera.  The size of the camera is great.  Fits in a pocket with ease.

Reviews.Title: Super handy and quick
Reviews.Author: G3
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an "intermediate" camera - - in between my cell phone and 30:1 digital zoomer. It fits in a big pocket, or in a small belt pouch - take your choice. (Since I was traveling in pick-pocket areas, I put it in my pocket and kept my hand in my pocket too.)I am VERY pleased. It comes on almost instantaneously, and it also focuses quickly and shoots fast, recovering in less than a second for the next shot.Film speed is good, defaults to 1600. Not exactly for night photography, but low-light is no problem at all.The viewfinder (thanks Canon) is for me indispensable, since LED screens are so hard to see in daylight (not to mention having to get out my reading glasses). I wish other vendors would add the viewfinder back in, but Canon seems to be the last holdout.Another thing I REALLY like for traveling is the AA batteries. Yeah, you have to buy batteries, but you do not have to carry a charger around (and of course forget to charge your spare battery, as we all will eventually do). This only uses two AA's, and they last a LONG time, maybe 500-1000 (non-flash) photos or thereabouts.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Terrific little camera
Reviews.Author: P. Freeman
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to Peru.  Love the AA batteries.  Using Lithium batteries, my wife only needed to change batteries once while taking approximately 1500 pictures.  Camera is very lightweight.  It isn't the smallest camera available (due to AAs) but still easy to fit in pocket or small camera bag.The only complaints I have relate to the multi-function button-wheel on the back.  First, the wheel is slightly recessed and it was a bit challenging to make selections with my fingers.  My wife didn't have any problems.  Secondly, we often pressed the flash selection button when pulling the camera out of its case.  This caused several times where we accidentally activated the flash when not needed, then had to wait a few seconds for the recharge before we could take the next picture.Overall, a great little camera.  I also purchased the SX160IS for myself and liked it better (it is an incredible deal for only $50 more), but the A1400 is a terrific choice for a small, lightweight, travel camera.

Reviews.Title: love the viewfinder camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth Lapp
Reviews.Content: good price and love the viewfinder so I can see to take pictures no matter where the sun is.  good camera

Reviews.Title: Good for bright light only
Reviews.Author: Still Chilly in Colorado
Reviews.Content: Having just put this thing through a week of testing on a trip out to California, I can report and confirm that this camera only takes acceptable photos in good light. However, I was able to get a nice night time shot in a well-lit marina by turning off the flash and setting the camera on something solid. There is definitely more noise in the photo, but the exposure came out far better than expected. Zooming in to just about any degree, even in good light, significantly adds to the amount of noticeable noise. In video mode, don't even think of using the zoom. Leave it in the widest angle setting or you'll be disappointed in how much noise there is. If you are shooting video into the general direction of the sun and there is any sort of reflection of the sun, say on the water, you will get horribly obvious and obtrusive vertical bars (about 1/8" wide on the LCD) streaming through the image that will totally ruin the shot you were after. The sensor obviously can't handle that sort of exposure. My iPhone has handled similar exposure with no problems at all. Also, in video mode, the optical viewfinder does not show the effects of the zoom button. The image remains at the widest setting no matter what you do with the zoom button. If you plan to use the zoom in video mode, you MUST use the LCD on the back of the camera to frame your shot. If you use the optical viewfinder and then zoom in, you'll have absolutely no idea what your are capturing. This camera should basically only be used for general landscape photos in good light, or perhaps for basic indoor snapshots with the flash. I got it for free and will probably give it away and look for something better to use as a point-and-shoot when I don't feel like lugging my Nikon DSLR along.

Reviews.Title: Last Value Camera with Optical Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: David Jones
Reviews.Content: Photos and exposure settings on the Canon A1400 are superior to smartphones.  Having the optical view finder allows for more steady shots; since, my head does not shake as much as my extended arms.  This 16 megapixel image quality is equal to my 5 year old $320 Canon A650 with 12 MP, which had received 1st place prizes in amateur photo contests.  My image quality comparisons at ASA 100 were made using a tripod with both cameras.  Also, how can one beat using light weight 9X-life lithium AA batteries that last for hundreds of photos and image reviews?  Furthermore, when comparing the A1400 to the smartphone, there is a flash which reaches 10 feet or more.  So you should buy one of these before Canon pulls more models from the market.  I recommended that friend buy this camera one year ago, and I wish I had bought mine then too.

Reviews.Title: Canon Designers Got It Right !  Optical Viewfinder is a MUST Have for outdoor shooting
Reviews.Author: R. Allen
Reviews.Content: First, I am so glad Canon provides optical viewfinders on these cameras. It makes shooting in sunny conditions a breeze, no squinting to see faint images on LCD screens.HD video is great. User friendly, quick to learn interface. I didn't read any manuals and I was using all the features within 30 minutes. The close up macro shooting came  on automatically when I got extra close to a flower - - - Outstanding! The image stabilization working fine. Its a powerhouse camera that is small, but still has a firm grip and heft. Fits in my pockets. Has a tripod bushing and a help button. This is the result of years of experience and refinements in digital camera design and I took great care in selecting this camera, and it has turned out to be a success!My only suggestion is the 4-way navigation ring have better tactile properties so I can feel the right position with my finger, sometimes I hit the ring and interior button in the wrong place.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, don't let the low price fool you....
Reviews.Author: ejhc1
Reviews.Content: Great pic quality!  Easy to use and I can use rechargeable AA batteries! No need to buy expensive proprietary batteries.  Also, a rare camera to have an optical viewfinder at a low price.  I don't think you will get better pics from paying more - I know, I use Canon DSLRs 50D, 30D with L lenses.Great camera, great price, get one!

Reviews.Title: Response to "Lack of info on amazon"
Reviews.Author: Canon Lover
Reviews.Content: I remember when I did buy my first 35mm Canon TX.  It was the top of the line at that time.  Canon tries to listen to customers and I think they do pretty good job.  Now about this 1400.  I have the 1200 model.  I have never worried about how to download pictures, because I removed the SD card and plugged to SD card to USB adapter.  I used Windows Explorer to get the pictures.  I recommend the same to you.  These adapters are available at Micro Centers or I am sure you can get them here in Amazon.  I hope you can find one.  Good luck!  Actually, I am thinking to buy this 1400 model besides my 1200.  These are the few ones which have viewfinders.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ron "RRH"
Reviews.Content: The eyepiece is the biggest feature.  You can't find one anywhere else unless you pay a lot more.  Camera takes great pictures and its tough.  I slipped and fell in Sicily in September.  Camera flew out of my hand and bounced off two cement walls before it hit the ground.  Nothing worked so I thought it was toast.  I took it back to the hotel and noticed the turret was out of line.  With nothing to lose, I attempted to bend it back.  something went Pop and everything functioned perfectly.  Still running great in December.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot With View Finder
Reviews.Author: DonSpansk
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the functionality and ease of use of this camera. The photographs are very good quality. What we really like and the reason for the purchase was the viewfinder (eyepiece) this camera has. All too often, the visual display on the camera back is "washed out" and difficult to see in strong sunlight. The viewfinder allows the subject to be captured perfectly under all light conditions. No complaints about this camera; also a very reasonable price, and we like the idea that it utilizes easy to obtain AA batteries, both alkaline and rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot Perfection
Reviews.Author: cinetrope
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Canon and own an XL2 and a T4i but sometimes they stay at home or in the case due to their size and set-up requirements. Having decided to get a point and shoot I quickly decided that the A 1400 was the right choice for me. Easy to learn and use, small enough to fit in a shirt pocket, and powered by AA batteries it makes shooting photos and 720p video a breeze and now I never leave home without it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Mark Sandperl
Reviews.Content: A great camera to place in you "togo" kit. Pictured quality is better than average. Battery life with lithium batteries is very good and you can get AA anyplace... and then there is the price, which is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: NO BRAINER
Reviews.Author: E. Marie Sherwood
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera for me.  I am digitally challenged, and still had no problem figuring out how to use it.  It takes a great photo.  It's a little slow, but not enough to make me regret my purchase.  I was VERY happy with the person who wrote the review, about be sure to take the few extra steps needed to get the memory card!  I almost missed that, much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1400
Reviews.Author: B. Zerangue
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my wife as a Christmas gift and she seems to really like it.  I used it and was very satisfied with the quality and ease of use.  Picture quality is just as good as a more expensive Canon that we own.

Reviews.Title: positive review
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I have not had a digital camera for a number of years.  I am very pleased that I chose the PowerShot 1400.  The price is definitely right and it works great.  The manual takes a long time to download (215 pages), but it is worth having.

Reviews.Title: Five star "PLUS"
Reviews.Author: neper
Reviews.Content: If anyone is looking for a camera with "DUAL" viewing option, LCD screen as well a PEEP HOLE to view that subject material in bright sunlight, this camera is for you, great price, great camera and great Canon customer service. Everything you want in a point & Shoot pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Ducky one
Reviews.Author: amado gonzalez
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features I needed, easy to understand which was important for someone like me, older yet not the wiser when it comes to technology. Shipping was prompt and actually came before date promised.

Reviews.Title: Sharp, good finder, great customer service
Reviews.Author: David Burch
Reviews.Content: I couldn't figure out how to change the file size this camera records -- Canon's email customer service had the solution in my inbox in less than 24 hours, on a weekend. This model runs on AA batteries, available anywhere, and has an optical eye-level finder that zooms with the lens. These are features I miss in recent digital cameras, but this one has both. The matte surface and general ergonomic layout make this camera easy to handle. Very glad I came across this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: John A. Chartier "Skynet"
Reviews.Content: Sale price was already down to $59. I had an Amazon credit for $20 too. So I only paid $39 for it. Hard to complain at that price. This replaced a 7 year old Canon that I had. I played around with all the settings for hours until I was able to get the best pictures possible. It was a little bit of a learning curve because I was already so used to my other camera. But this one is pretty nice. I can't say that the pictures are that much better. To be honest they pretty much look the same as my 7 year old camera. However this camera has a setting to take full HD pics which is a major plus. I've seen some people complain about grainy pictures. This is probably because they took it right out of the box and just started snapping pics. There are a few adjustments you need to make on this camera to get good quality photos. First of all, turn the iso setting down to either 100, 200 or 400. This will fix the grainy pictures. The iso setting is jacked way up when you take it out of the box and it makes the pics look like crap. So play around with this camera for 3 or 4 hours before you give up on it. It's not a bad camera at all. You'll just need to test some of the different settings out. This thing has full screen HD video as well. So you are getting both a decent camera and a Video recorder all rolled into one. Definitely worth the price!

Reviews.Title: One button takes photos. Another button takes movies. No messing with  mode switches
Reviews.Author: Chris Garvey "Patent Lawyer"
Reviews.Content: Optical  viewfinder is nice when the sun is washing out the screen.One button takes photos. Another button takes movies. No messing with  mode switches and menus.Fast to boot-up and start shooting, unlike my cell phone.2 AA batteries, so no messing with a charger and special batteries.I bought it after trying to use my cell phone at an airshow, where I missed most shots, waiting for mode changes.I have a waterproof Kodak, which is nice, but the mode changes are a nuisance.And the lack of optical viewfinder is a handicap.If I'm not getting wet, I prefer the Cannon.I'd give the Cannon 5 stars, if it were waterproof.

Reviews.Title: The Best Little Camera I've Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: Grandjan
Reviews.Content: The pictures are brilliantly clear with wonderful color. The batteries last a long time, so no worries about frequent recharging. It easily fits in your pocket, and uploading pictures to my notebook is a breeze. I just love it!

Reviews.Title: Mom likes it
Reviews.Author: Britbrit
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom. She is not very tech savvy and always stuck to buying those disposable cameras. But after being picked on by the family this thanksgiving, I decided to bring her into the 21st century. So I picked this one because it has a viewfinder (like her disposable cameras) and took AA batteries so she didn't have to worry about charging it. I was pleasantly surprised when i opened the box and saw that all the buttons and controls were designed in a very simple way. It's like the camera was made for the technologically impaired. It even has a help button with a ? on it. Very simple and easy to understand. Perfect for mom! I only gave 4 stars because it did not come with a memory card or a cable to connect it to the computer. So you have to make a couple other purchases before you can even use it. But the pictures seem to come out fine and she is happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Must buy!
Reviews.Author: modus77
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife because our other camera is a larger SLR type camera.This camera is the perfect size for carrying in a pocket or purse.As other people have said, the picture and video quality is absolutely excellent as it captures full, vibrant colors.I don't see how anybody could regret buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Paid around $70 for this great little camera. So far it has been awesome, great quality shots and easy to use. Got it as a Christmas present and they have been extremely pleased with it. I would recommend for someone wanting a basic, easy to use point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: It has good points/Price was right
Reviews.Author: apyre
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because although I do not need an expensive camera, I wanted a better camera. Currently I have a Kodak C195 digital camera. Its an ok camera, but the buttons are too small, uses too much battery, no night time pics. I originally was going to get a Canon that was on sale @ Walmart, but that was a come on never in stock. Anyway, I finally decided on the Canon A1400 mostly for the price.  What I do like is the viewfinder, and the larger buttons (much easier to use for us older folks). No real improvement on night time moon pics. Haven't used it enough to decide if it is easier on the batteries. It uses two AA, which is good. Also I had to order the usb cable separate, but not a real issue since Amazon sold me one for $5. Overall pix are about the same as the Kodak camera, but this camera is much easier to use. Also I did get a free 8G memory card with the order.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Joseph Jackson
Reviews.Content: Now we or talking, this camera I really fell in love with not to heavey what I may call just right order so Thank yall for this one

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Tanveer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my dad on christmas, he loves it! it has 5x zoom and the picture quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Can't adjust color like on earlier "A" series
Reviews.Author: David Brock
Reviews.Content: Been using Cannon point and shoot cameras for years and can't say enough good things, that is until the 1400. Apparently it doesn't have a way to adjust the colors like on older models. The only setting is one for 'Super Vivid'. So much less control which is not cool. I also miss a quick way to switch shooting modes via the little dial-wheel, but now I must stop and click on the Func button then click around until I find the appropriate setting. Very frustrating compared to earlier models.  I'll still give it 2 stars because it's a Cannon and still takes pretty good pictures, just much more frustrating trying to get the right setting.

Reviews.Title: A camera for the knowledgeable amateur photographer.  Easy to carry and use.
Reviews.Author: Brian Crook "Copywriter and economist"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the optical viewfinder feature, which means you can frame a picture in bright light which makes the LCD screen useless.Two surprises: the camera comes without memory cards. and it uses AA batteries rather than a rechargeable cell.  Batteries included, I found 2GB SD cards at Wal-Mart sold in packs of 2 for about $12.There are many features that I have yet to learn - the English version of the user manual is over 200 pages!  This is a fully-capable camera with the controls a serious photographer can use.  Fits in a shirt pocket, but large enough for easy handling.

Reviews.Title: One Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: Wade
Reviews.Content: A pocket-able camera with a view finder made by Canon and selling for less than $100?Upon opening the box, I was pleasantly surprised that I could grab it from multiple angles without activating any controls. Next I was surprised to see the batteries did not make the unit uncomfortably side heavy. The flash is thankfully not a popup. The larger recessed power button and indented battery compartment cover were large enough that I didn't have to aim unduly with my large fingers.  The start up and lag times were better than I dared hope. The operating controls kept the same Canon theme. The news just kept getting better as I continued exploring.As for the quality of pictures and it's ability to shoot in low light situations? Very good, especially in low light.

Reviews.Title: Going back to my A710
Reviews.Author: Barry Frank
Reviews.Content: Wanted an upgrade since my A710's USB connection seems to have died. But the A1400, while lighter and sleeker has several *downgrades*. These include: a menu search for the macro setting compared to the single button on the A710; no option for setting your own shutter speed &/or aperture; and poor metering. I know it's a P&S;, but the A710 does quite well in those areas. Yes, the A1400 has more than twice the MP (16 vs. 7.1), but I'm not making 16x20 prints or doing pixel by pixel shopping, and I've never had an issue with resolution on the A710.

Reviews.Title: Just a great little inexpensive camera ($60.)?
Reviews.Author: CAPRICORN ONE
Reviews.Content: Hi,I have my main Canon SX260 camera & this little one is a backup. Sometimes, when you travel near or far, it's nice to know you have a very adequate backup when your main camera might have an accident? My SX260 is very nice (has a sturdy metal case, full hd, 20x zoom, fantastic!)  BUT the A1400 has a CCD sensor while my SX260 uses the CMOS (the CCD type sensor gives you  a better quality picture). Also, the A1400 has a larger 16.1 Megapixel effective image size but the SX260 only has 12.1 megapixels (interesting?). Even the newer SX280 model keeps those same CMOS & 12.1 megapixel sensors?I really love the view finder on the A1400 (on so many occasions, that sun is directly overhead) and unless you have one of those "TILT LCDs", it drives me crazy to clearly see what I'm trying to film? And of course, the double AA battery power (for colder areas, you can buy some extra lithium to prevent any freeze-up) is fantastic. You can get double AAs anywhere, plus most of us have the Eneloop rechargeables?This camera is small & lite and will fit in most pockets, especially anything like cargo shorts. The camera gives great still pics & the HD is fine but of course my SX260 is way better in anything with video. Yet, I know my little backup camera will provide me with nice pics & HD vids wherever I am, if my main camera ever stops working properly! Finally, around ($60.) for a nice, new Canon camera, this was a real easy choice for me?-------------------------------------------TIPS:?01 - I use a leftover (rock the frogskins, pacific blue / Oakley nylon sunglass bag/pouch, looks really good!) to cover/protect the camera/lens. Of course, these bags are the micro type & nice if you ever have to wipe some speck of dust/dirt off your lense. For me, the nylon pouch is fine for this small backup and they sell them at any mall.02 - 2 extra slim case, Sandisk 32gb SDHC cards with the camera, easily fit in this bag.03 - Also, Amazon sells these cool "PowerPax Storacell Slim Line" AA battery caddies & they work great.  Their orange color will make a nice contrast and they have many other colors available?04 - Another nice thing about this camera is that the insides, actually have markings for the proper way to face your memory card & batteries. My SX260 doesn't, so if I haven't used it for awhile (markings would be helpful?). The A1400 can also use the higher capacity SDXC, eXtra capacity memory card. For me, this newer SDXC card is great, 64 or 128GB, you can movie forever. Yet, my old VISTA system isn't fond of it, I have to use one of those USB computer cords to download (AMAZON, sells an A1400 cord for around $6.00). It immediately loads the (JPEC & MOV), no problem. Then, I'll double-click the "MOV" and Apples Quicktime will convert, I'll login to Utube where the movie file is converted to an "MP4" format, so easier to manage!05 - Lastly, sometimes you might be taking pics around water (a boat ride under the Golden Gate or the surf around some rocky beach - lots of spray), nevermind it might be one of those drizzle days? If your just taking tourist or web shots, why risk getting moisture on the lens or in-between the zoom mechanism of your best camera, use the A1400 (16.1 megapixels) ain't bad and I'm thinking of buying another (just for this reason alone?).-------------------------------------------SX280:1080p/60p Full HD videoWith the camera's advanced DIGIC 6 Image Processor enabling "MP4" format recording, the PowerShot SX280 HS lets you shoot video at a selectable frame rate of 60 fps or 30 fps. 1080p/60p Full HD video is extraordinarily smooth and rich in playback, ensuring that your important memories and creative film clips look their absolute best. Video recorded at 30 fps has also been improved through the combination of the DIGIC 6 Image Processor and Fine Movie Detail Processing, with reduced noise and high resolution.-------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Patrick Swerkstrom
Reviews.Content: Canon is gradually eliminating all of the control features that have made their point and shoot cameras my first choice.  Since I first started with my Canon A95, they have eliminated manual control of shutter, aperture, closeup mode, and others.  In addition, they have sadly moved most of their remaining choices into the digital age.  It takes several "clicks" to get into closeup.  P (Program) gives you virtually no choices but ASA rating.  The camera will take acceptable photos only under optimum lighting conditions.  The thumb button video mode is touchy, thereby causing video shots you thought you were recording to be missed.My wife has the A1200 and it is far more acceptable, even though it, too, lacks several of the manual choices their older cameras had.I would give the A1400 no stars or one star except that supposedly means "I Hate It" which is a little strong for even this camera.Only good features left are the viewfinder (mine is out of focus, by the way) and AA batteries.Enjoy........

Reviews.Title: Finally a good brand, compact with optical viewfinder
Reviews.Author: JOAO E. A. MOTTA "jeamotta"
Reviews.Content: I choose this Camera because it is a brand well known and the decision fator was the optical viewfinder, very dificult to find in the actual cameras ( I  dont know why because it is impossible to have a good vision in the screen with much light).

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price but...
Reviews.Author: Bearl
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures for the price but it is very slow.  You will not be able to use this camera for moving subjects or for low light photography.  It is only slightly better than a cell phone camera, and that is due to the optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, small camera, view finder and very affordable.
Reviews.Author: James Kaufman "jkauf"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It performs in full light almost as well as my EOS DSLR, but I can put in my pocket. View finder is great in full sunlight. Fantastic price - takes wonderful pictures. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Get something better
Reviews.Author: Samuel Harvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it was on sale. Now I know why it was so cheap.Pros: Lightweight. Large LCD screen. Great battery life. Retains settings after powering off/changing batteries. It is really small and lightweight.Cons: Picture quality is unsatisfactory. Feels cheap. Design was not well thought out.One of my biggest gripes is the battery slot/flashcard design. The cover for it feels like it can snap off at any time. The batteries and flashcard slot are in the same area and whenever one wants to take out the flashcard, the batteries seem to want to pop out. You have to be really careful when closing the slot, as it is flimsy and the hinge is not solid at all and the batteries push out a little bit when you open it, so I can see how this could break off if you aren't very careful with it.. The usb port worked for a while, so I didn't have to take the flashcard out to transfer pictures, but now it doesn't seem to work. The covering for the usb port also feels like it can snap off if not treated gently. The camera also didn't come with a usb cable, so you'll have to buy one unless you want to deal with the flashcard/battery slot issue all the time. For a camera that is advertised as 16 MP the picture quality is terrible. My really old 2.4 MP camera takes higher quality shots, though this may be due to the optics used. I needed a new camera and thought this was a good deal. I guess I got what I paid for, but am disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Coming out of the learning curve a little more
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: Took me months to get the hang of this little guy.  At first couldn't take a decent picture or figure out what to adjust or where. Had downloaded the manual, but it wasn't helping me a lot. Menu items appear for some things and disappear for others.  I'm liking it more and more as I get familiar with what can be done -- understanding what circumstances go with what menu choices, when to switch to automatic, when not to use some thing that distorts the color of the scene, etc. Changed to rechargeable eneloope AA batteries that last a lot longer per use than the alkaline.  That is helping me go through the screen prompts and not worry about running down batteries.  Gives me time to learn the different menu combinations.  Still trying out some features to get the hang of the whole thing, but my pictures are getting much better.

Reviews.Title: mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the intention of carrying it with me all the time.  I never expected it to be the same quality as my DSLR, but wanted something portable, that if it got ruined, wouldn't make me cry. Best thing about this camera - a viewfinder.  I've only printed out 4x6 photos so far, but the pic quality is just fine.  Similar menus as my other Canon Cameras, so easy to get the hang of , even without a manual.  I know a lot of other reviewers complained about there not being a cord included in the box,  but most computers now days have a card reader, and  you can buy one pretty cheap if your computer doesn't have one.  I haven't used a cord to download pics for our last 2 computers.I almost gave this a 4 star rating, but have had issues with the retractable lens - sometimes it doesn't want to zoom.  So far if I turn it off & on again I can get it to work, but it's annoying. Other than that, I think it is a great little camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in picture quality
Reviews.Author: MikeB
Reviews.Content: I have an old Canon Power Shot SD450, rechargeable type battery with  "5.0 MegaPixels". The battery is bad so instead of ordering a new battery I thought this camera with "16MP" and 2 AA batteries would be great. No recharging batteries and 16MP would blow my SD450 away. WRONG!! The pictures from my SD450 will blow this so called 16MP away.  No comparison!So I sent the A1400 back and ordered 2 new NB-4L batteries for my SD450.It's old but it takes very clear pictures!!  I'll just keep it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for not a lot of cash!
Reviews.Author: Michael Livote "dragon2knight"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's got plenty of perks for a low price, starting with plenty of great shooting modes...or just leave it on auto and enjoy the simplicity of great pics with zero effort. The 720p video was a pleasant surprise as well, I find myself using it much more than I thought I would, it makes videos a breeze to shoot. Battery life with rechargeable batteries is great, with over 250 pics taken before a recharge was needed and being able to use regular alkaline AA's is a nice thing to have when on vacation.I love the size as well, small enough to slip into a pocket, but designed as such as to allow easy one handed use, something I think is essential when using a camera. All told, for the low price, this is a no brainer if your looking for ease of use, great pics, and good video with Canon's great quality added.

Reviews.Title: Too grainy
Reviews.Author: lavaland
Reviews.Content: Gave camera for wife to use. 'Point and shoot' I told her...well, the pictures that did come out okay are too grainy and cannot be enlarged without extreme distortion. All shots were taken indoors so that may be the problem, the lighting and all.Lot of shots were out of focus, people walking onto stage during an awards program.Not a camera for the kids or wives who just want a 'point and shoot' and not have to worry about anything else.I am going to retry it myself..outdoors and indoors and see what happens. Could be my missus and not the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Dominic Lovell
Reviews.Content: Great basic camera at an excellent price.Small but with large screen,Very sharp picture quality.Regular AA batteries and a viewfinder a definiteplus for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but no instructions
Reviews.Author: James Johnson "James"
Reviews.Content: With an old Mavica disk camera on its last legs, I finally bought this digital.  It seems to work fine, with what I've figured out so far.  Instruction sheet is grossly inadequate; it mainly just tells you how to turn it on (in 12 languages) and has diagrams that don't match actual unit.  Will have to do some on-line research for better instructions.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Paul Peterson
Reviews.Content: The one thing that I really like about this camera is that has a view finder. This is not often found on this type of camera any more.Secondly, I like that it uses standard AA batteries as I use it on the Job and don't have time for recharging! Also, by not using the LCD screen while taking pictures, it saves a lot of battery life.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: ervin d caldwell
Reviews.Content: Very easy to operate.  Pictures are great.  Battery life is good. For a point and click camera it's perfect. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Not complicated to use.
Reviews.Author: Gemma Brathwaite
Reviews.Content: The camera  met my expectations. Not complicated for anyone to use. Great value for price. Worth it can be used for amateur or professional.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Carol Short
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for the price, easy to use and takes great pics!  We received exactly what was described very quickly.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Small, lightweight, easy
Reviews.Author: Snowreader
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old Canon point and shoot was stolen recently, and I have an iPad and a good phone, but still like to use a camera for some things. For the price, this is great. Black, plastic, not much to look at, but it takes good pictures and fits in a woman 's pocket. Uses AA batteries, another plus., plus it has a viewfinder, which my stolen camera did not have. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: gun guy 98
Reviews.Content: btw to get to your camera filters press the auto button (or the delete button) and set it to livethen press the middle button (or func.set button) and then you can pick what mode you wantI really like this camera so here are some prospro: smallpro: easy to usepro: high qualitypro: takes great picturespro: has a view findernow here are some conscon: only 5x optical zoomand that's really all the cons so I give this little camera 5 0f 5 stars

Reviews.Title: best christmas ever!
Reviews.Author: Ross
Reviews.Content: 2 years ago my daughter broke my wife's digital camera screen which made it unusable since it didnt have a viewfinder...and its taken me forever to find a good camera with a viewfinder since almost every company has gone without one...well i got news for ya I'm a professional photographer and this thing has really nice quality photos... this made my wife's Christmas the best ever. if you are an old-school point and shoot person that likes a viewfinder...this is the one for you! it doesn't have a ton of bells and whistles but it does the job very very well!

Reviews.Title: IS A GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Enrique Solano Salas
Reviews.Content: it IS a Great camera, but whe i bough the camera it say that I will get MEMORY CARD AND AND I DIN'T GET IT, THATS VERY DESAPOINTED.here is the advertise:Free 8GB Memory Card with the Purchase of This CameraPurchase the Canon PowerShot A1400 and get a free Sandisk 8GB memory card when you buy from Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Lagasse
Reviews.Content: Does what I want it to do. Pure and Simple. Love that it has more than just the screen to see what you are taking for a picture.

Reviews.Title: Decent digital camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this Canon Powershot A1400 digital camera here, even tho it was cheaper elsewhere and available here. This camera replaces a very similar Canon Powershot camera I have now. The only differences with this camera is it has a hard-to-find optical viewfinder on this camera and an "Economy mode" on this camera. I am not sure what difference the "Economy Mode" is with batteries, but battery life with this camera seems acceptable and uses 2 "AA" batteries, just like my prior Canon digital camera did and battery life with that prior Canon camera was unacceptable....this one seems a bit better using the "EM". Photo quality is fine for a compact digital camera and I usually carry this camera for quick photos when I need a photo quickly. Video quality is good for a digital camera. I really have just 1 gripe with this camera and don't expect DSLR-quality photos with this camera, but you will get decent photos. My one main gripe is that shutter lag is bad with this camera and it takes a bit longer than usual to take photos with this camera. 5X optical zoom is decent for this camera and fairly typical for current compact digital cameras now. This camera is fairly easy to use and has a simple menu system on the LCD screen on the camera's backside and about the same as my prior Canon digital camera....a plus.If you need a basic compact digital camera that takes decent photos and video's for under $90, this camera should do just fine. Only shutter lag is bad with this camera and that annoys me a bit.....but I don't expect a speedy camera for a compact digital camera. I give this digital camera 3 of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA SLOANE
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera. It is just what I wanted. Nothing too complicated but easy enough to download photos to my laptop and upload for my work on line. I like being able to resize the photo file if necessary too. It is comfortable to hold with one hand. I appreciated reading all the feedback on the camera before I bought it so I knew to have a memory card and batteries when it arrived.

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR MY USE
Reviews.Author: A W Adams
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because it has a viewfinder and is quite reasonably priced. Most digital cameras with a viewfinder are quite a bit more money.  So far, it works great.  Its drawbacks are that it does not come with a manual or "chips."

Reviews.Title: Good for holidays and holidays.
Reviews.Author: TheAmazingShane
Reviews.Content: Originally for my honeymoon I was going to buy a low end Prosumer grade Nikon as I have a few lenses from video stuff. My wife pointed out that maybe I didn't want to take expensive lenses and camera overseas. After much searching, I found this!This is pretty compact, perfect for pocket storage. It turns on pretty quickly too so if you are in a rush, it won't take too long to get that picture!The low light ability isn't terrible, but it's not great either. Light noise.You've also got expandable memory so you can swap cards and take more pictures! Or videos.I would recommend buying this for a vacation, or holiday events.

Reviews.Title: Camera OK
Reviews.Author: Rat Guru
Reviews.Content: The camera I bought had a defective CCD and I returned it.  Had to pay return postage and a restocking fee.  Postage I can understand, but why do I have to pay a restocking fee for a defective product?  That cost should be sent on to the manufacturer, it's their product that's defective.  Turn around time for a replacement was too long (needed camera for a vacation) so I just returned it and went to Bi-Mart and bought one.  Cost a little more, but they will take back items and not charge you a restocking fee.Camera itself takes great pictures, but does not come with a SD card.  What good is a camera if you can't take pictures right out of the box?  Also do not like the fact that there is no manual.  You can get one online, of course, but it is over 200 pages long!!!  Not what I want to download and print at home. Overall camera is nice, especially with the viewfinder and compact enough to fit in my pocket.Just checked today for my refund and discovered I was not charged a restocking fee.  I guess my nasty letter I sent along with the returned item worked.

Reviews.Title: Okay for general use
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with a built in flash (no annoying pop-up device), decent (10x) optical zoom and that uses AA batteries.  This camera seemed to have everything except the 10x zoom.  It takes decent pictures and works fine outdoors.  Unfortunately, the flash takes forever to charge, which is quite frustrating when taking pictures indoors or in low light.On the plus side, the camera is quite small and fits easily into a pocket.  It also has an optical viewfinder, which is really handy when taking pictures in bright sunlight, which tends to make it difficult to see the image on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Simple and functional
Reviews.Author: Skoog
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Powershot I've owned in the last 4 years or so.I manage to break or damage these about every year or two, so I suppose that's a data point.  I use these cameras constantly, and don't think another brand in the same class of camera would do any better in terms of robustness.  The lens covers and mechanism that opens and closes the lens have been the point of breakage on both previous cameras.I prefer Powershots mainly because I'm now pretty familiar with using them.  I like the optical view finder, because I have trouble seeing the digital screen that most cameras provide as the only way to frame the shot.  If you are not over 45 yet, you will understand that remark later in life.The camera has a large bundle of features, most of which I've never used.  Once I've configured it, I don't like to mess around with settings in the field, and this camera does the basics without needing any more attention.I think these are a good value for people needing high quality snapshots of action events.  There is a frustrating delay between pushing the shutter button and capturing the shot, which gets worse as the batteries wear out and when the flash is needed.  However, this has been consistently observed on other brands of camera as well.I take ALOT of pictures, so I prefer the AA batteries used in this camera, which can be replaced in the field.  2 AA batteries will cover me for about 200 photos, which is plenty good for one event.  I carry a couple spare sets of AA's in the camera case, and consider myself ready for anything.  The camera is compact and its case fits comfortably on my belt, or in some cases hooked to a belt loop with a mini-snaplink.

Reviews.Title: Flash has to charge between shots
Reviews.Author: StoicPlatypus
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I purchased my camera through Kmart.I bought the PowerShot A1400 because I wanted a simple point and shoot camera.  This certainly does the job, but the flash has to charge after each use.  It's a delay of about 2-3 seconds but it's just enough to interrupt shooting, especially if there's a lot of activity you're trying to capture.  So that's a big drawback for me.It does take nice quality photos.On the pros, it's very light (plastic case), uses a standard SD cards but also has an A/V output in case you don't have a card reader handy, and I like the optical zoom.  I think it also takes video.  Otherwise, there's not much to say about it: it's basic, and if that's what you want/need it will do the job, as long as you can put up with the flash delay.

Reviews.Title: I bought to replace
Reviews.Author: sdbmshad
Reviews.Content: This camera is an absolute dream to use. So simple from the first time picking up. Point and shoot. All there is to it. Takes beautiful pictures. I really enjoy using it. Would defiantly buy again!

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: Shelley Hatke
Reviews.Content: This camera will fit my needs to have a camera in my pocket. It takes good pictures and is easy to use. The battery cover is a little flimsy. The camera is light and easy to take along and use. I am happy with the product

Reviews.Title: many a blurry shot
Reviews.Author: Young Shopper 123
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with hope that I could use my phone's camera a little less, save battery life, get better, quicker photos, etc. Wrong. The photos taken with this camera are mostly blurry images. The shots take forever to take- missing all action shots. The battery dies so fast. I bought this for a cruise, and it took me too long to be able to return it. Stuck with a crummy camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera Power Shot A1400 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: LaPlante
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to use - I find the learning curve steep. So many menu's & the picture's are not that crisp, and the movies are slightly blurred. Does not seem consistant in it's operation - or maybe it's me.Electronics operation seems sloppy. Made in China.Easy to block flash with fingers, as I found out many times. Price was right, but it came with nothing but a strap, so had to buy SD card, Camera to TV cable and camera to computer cable.  No instruction book included; download from Canon site & print 134 or so pages if you want a permanent copy.If you are an older person, forget it, or find a digital Brownie. :-)Spend more money & buy something else.Also a must for this camera - rechargeable batteries & the flash does not seem bright enough for decewnt pics and sometimestakes longer to recharge for the next picture.

Reviews.Title: The perfect gift for my young niece.
Reviews.Author: GE, Acworth, GA
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera a five star rating because my niece raves about how much she loves it, how easy it is to use and what good pictures she gets.Those reasons make it a great gift for the money.I would recommend this product to any beginning photographer or someone who just needs a small camera to keep handy.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT little camera
Reviews.Author: evvymac
Reviews.Content: Wonderful!!  I love having a battery operated camera again!It takes great photos!!  Easy to operate.Love it and will use it often!!

Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera for Quality and Price Plus--AND Has View Finder!
Reviews.Author: Karla Berg Walker
Reviews.Content: It's impossible to find a small camera at this price point with a view finder, but Canon has done it! The photos are incredible and the batteries last for ever in this camera! I am so pleased with the quality of the photos and the ease of using this camera. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: if you want a viewfinder...
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: in an inexpensive little camera, this one has it. While the picture quality seems middling they are quite acceptable in a camera that cost less than $60.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera and I love the viewfinder
Reviews.Author: G. Bisaillon "Navette"
Reviews.Content: I bought it on sale for $61.99 so I can't really complain but I wish the "Scenes" were more easily accessible, as they were on my old cheap camera. You have to dig into the menu to find it, and by then your subject can have disappeared!Otherwise, I'm amazed at the quality for the price and the manual (PDF) is easy to follow. I downloaded it to my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Tiny camera with lots of MP
Reviews.Author: Myrna C. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how small this camera really is.  As noted by other reviewers, the flash recharge is slow.  Aside from that, it is a great back-up to my larger cameras and has an optical viewfinder which enables one to see in bright light without using the screen.  Another bonus is that it only requires AA batteries.  No need to carry any recharging devices and converters -- great for travel.

Reviews.Title: great service & camera with a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Patty Creamer
Reviews.Content: fast delivery, just what i was looking for. it has viewfinder. wish it had a manual that came with it but it has menu button.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste money
Reviews.Author: mtairymama "32 yo"
Reviews.Content: This takes horrible pictures. You need to hold the camera perfectly still, click the button without moving the camera at ALL, and then keep holding the camera still till it slowly takes the picture. Unreal! Keep pulling it out to use and think it can't be as bad as I remember. Wrong, it is that bad.

Reviews.Title: Long flash recharge time and no forced flash "on"
Reviews.Author: Sarah Rusby
Reviews.Content: I returned it because my first use was at a wedding and I missed every shot because it kept reading "flash recharging" when I tried to take the pic...haven't seen that for probably 2 decades.  Also didn't like that you couldn't force the flash, it only had an automatic and an off choice.  So if it was bright out but your subjects faces were shaded you couldn't get the flash to go.  Glad I tested it before my upcoming vacation!

Reviews.Title: Nice compact camera with an optical viewfinder!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Junkie "reader"
Reviews.Content: My Canon PowerShot SD780IS is lighter and has an optical viewfinder, but it's already been in for replacement of parts, and I was looking for a compact camera with similar characteristics. This camera has a 5x optical zoom as well as an optical viewfinder. Don't understand why manufacturers feel that an LCD screen is an effective viewfinder... they clearly don't work in full sun or bright light. Although I prefer the lighter SD780IS, Canon no longer makes it. The PowerShot A1400 uses AA batteries (or rechargeable batteries), accepts a larger memory chip, and does longer video, so there are some advantages to the larger size... it just doesn't fit into a shirt pocket quite as easily. Photo quality is pretty good for a point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: justthefactsman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Canon Powershot A2500.  That camera gave me too many blurry photos.  I use this for work purposes, and I don't get paid for blurry photos,  and I can take anywhere from 100 to 340 photos in one day.  It doesn't have the dial with all the optional shooting positions which I never use.  It's a basic use camera which is all I need.  The menu is easy and readable.  I did save the cord to upload photos to the pc and it's what I use.  This camera did not come with one.  And I do use the zoom and the pictures come out good.  For a point and shoot, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sandra S Swetland
Reviews.Content: I think the Canon Powershot A1400 is a great little camera. I really appreciate the view finder when out side taking pictures. My old camera only had the window to view the picture you are taking, which in most cases was next to impossible. Now I have a choice when I am taking pictures. Love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Carry Around Camera
Reviews.Author: VietnamVet1968
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Use it as a everyday carry around camera so I will not have to take my DSLR with me everywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: Herb
Reviews.Author: Herbert Rixse
Reviews.Content: I have took thousands of pictures in my lifetime and my last camera being digital and it has wore out and I wanted a  camera yet, that use AA batteries and too one with a view finder so I choose this camera and it works alright

Reviews.Title: Perfect for hiking and climbing
Reviews.Author: Walter Runkle
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a light weight camera that uses AA batteries, has optical zoom, and most important, a VIEW FINDER!  LCD displays are useless to me out in bright sunlight.  This camera takes great pictures and is easy to use.  I like it better than the Powershot A540 I had because it is lighter than the A540 and it does NOT have any mode switch to break off like the A540 did.  My only complaint is the screw hole on the bottom is very close to the battery/memory card access door.  It's in a good location for balance, but when I screw my camera stand mounting tab to the camera it comes close to interfering with the access door.  But the door still opens and locks so this is a minor complaint.  I would still buy this camera again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera!  Buy very small.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Roberts
Reviews.Content: I am a novice at photography.  Therefore I felt this camera lacks a good owners manual.  I have a friend who knows camera's, and in in a few moments he was showing me things this little camera could do that was way beyond my expectations.However the photos of the unit, when I purchased made it, led me to believe it was larger.  Therefore I was very surprised at how small this is. (easily fits in a shirt pocket) However don't let its size fool you, as it appears very capable this far!  Initial photos look promising.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Al Smith
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because it has a view finder; the only way I can see a subject in bright sunlight. Without viewfinder in such  lighting I can only guess at what I will photograph.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot A1400
Reviews.Author: Maxine Miller
Reviews.Content: I love it because it has an view finder in addition to the screen.  It is simple to use and very light.  The pictures I have taken so far have been great.

Reviews.Title: It is a point and shoot, but a great one....
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I have an SLR with multiple lens that I love better, but this one is handy dandy.  Now the reason that this is a 4 instead of a 5 for a point and shoot camera is that I cannot get rechargeable batteries to work in it.  That is a big downsider if you are trying to be green.  Surely there is a rechargeable battery that can be recommended that will work.  Because the bottom line is that it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: The pictures come out crisp and clear. Very easy to use and I am extremely happy I bought it. Yea.

Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: kathryn hashem
Reviews.Content: happy with this purchase, good little camera for the price....only complaint is a slight lag time when the flash has to charge, but photos without flash load instantly

Reviews.Title: Canon makes the best!
Reviews.Author: P. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift for a student graduating high school. That student loved this camera and recognized that Canon makes great cameras. I would recommend this camera as a starting camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: David Samnick
Reviews.Content: Nice snap and shoot. I don't like the fact that it requires 2 AA batteries. Doesn't have a solid feel to it. It's functional but I wouldn't buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Changing batteries a lot
Reviews.Author: RVACountryLover
Reviews.Content: This takes very nice pictures and quality video for its make and size. However, if you use the video feature often, or take too many pictures, you'll find yourself changing the batteries every 2 hours of use or so. I think that might be why some people prefer getting the cameras that have a rechargeable lithium battery, instead of regular AAs.

Reviews.Title: Bought 4 - Have battery issues
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Haley
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these for my company for use at our facilities. I've given out 2 of them and both of them have been returned to me by 2 separate sites saying that the cameras will not remain on, even when they've switched out the batteries.I haven't tried the other two, but now I'm worried. If I can return them, I'm going to.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: gs1964
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter's birthday back in Oct 2013. Still not disspointed. For the price it works rather nice and it takes very nice pictures. Wish it had dropbox thought, but can't expect more. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Happy Happy Happy
Reviews.Author: shirley
Reviews.Content: A bday gift for my hubby. He loves it. He plays with toy cars and airplanes. Don't tell him I said so.

Reviews.Title: VERY COMPACT AND QUITE SATISFACTORY
Reviews.Author: IRV
Reviews.Content: It's a lot smaller than it looks, but it does fit into a shirt pocket. The functions are a  bit confusing since I've owned Kodaks in the past. Does not have internal memory. And I worry that the plastic cover that slides over the battery/card slots might break off if not careful. Have to download operating instructions.

Reviews.Title: My first camera, my last camera
Reviews.Author: Oilwelldoctor "oilwelldoctor"
Reviews.Content: My very first camera circa 2001 was a Canon PowerShot.  Lost it years ago in a taxi or to a former wife, and have bought/owned many others since.  Before this one, a well-known Japanese brand that was frankly crap.  I am back to PowerShots.  This is a great camera.  No issues and the seller delivered as advertised.  Great price too.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: terrific camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Pumphrey
Reviews.Content: It has a viewfinder!  This is a great starter camera for the digital holdouts.  It is easy to use and has a viewfinder which makes the transition from point and shoot film cameras easier.  Great image quality and color reproduction.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A15400
Reviews.Author: Sandra Johnston
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine but I really wish (even if the cost is increased) that a memory card had been included with the camera.  I received the camera and then find out I need to buy something else to use it!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: sharon
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera! Simple to use...well made and just as easy to carry...it's going to be a real treat to own and use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack Tabolich
Reviews.Content: Great camera for point and shoot. Only problem was no manual with it. best pictures ever taken. recommend to all new photographers

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Mere
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the price I paid.  I can see why it was cheaper.  I will continue to use it

Reviews.Title: My Husband's happy with it
Reviews.Author: Peanut
Reviews.Content: My husband lost our other camera the very first day of a cruise.  When we got home, I ordered this to replace the lost one.  My husband is the photographer in the family so if he's happy, I'm happy.  He liked this one better than the other one.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful small camera for everyday needs
Reviews.Author: Candace Williams
Reviews.Content: Have really enjoyed using this camera with a compactness which makes it easy to take along. The pictures are great quality and the camera functions well. It's easy to understand how to use it.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: MAR
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GOOD LITTLE CAMERA W/ A VIEW FINDER, NO GLARE WHEN SHOOTING IN SUNNY LOCATIONS. SMALL LIGHTWEIGHT AND GOOD PHOTOS.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: Ruth B. Carter
Reviews.Content: I looked high and low for a small, inexpensive camera with a viewfinder.  I do not have a need for anything high tech.  This camera is easy to use and I love it.  As others have said, the AA batteries make life a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: Powershot A1400 16.0 MP
Reviews.Author: NJ_Joe
Reviews.Content: I have not had this long enough but so far it takes great pictures and has been performing well for me.

Reviews.Title: Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Tony H. Joe, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Excited about my new product. Can't wait to try out this new camera. Read many good reviews about the Power shot, so I purchased one to see for myself how this product is.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: David L. Humpal
Reviews.Content: It takes very good photos and is easy to use.  My only complaint is the shutter lag which is a bit of an issue when photographing children or some type of action.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Chandler
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that took disposable batteries and from my experience you can never go wrong with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera for basic picture taking
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: great pics for a smaller camera that easily fits in pocket, usb not provided.but overall pic quality very good

Reviews.Title: Gift for wife
Reviews.Author: Ralph C. Boyer
Reviews.Content: My wife's last camera worked well but for some reason quit. She has had difficulty using the viewing screen to see what she is shooting. I bought this camera for her specifically because it has a viewfinder with which she can see what she desires to shoot. Gadgets are not her strong suit but this one does as well as can be expected for her. (Is that the right kind of suit? If not, too bad.)

Reviews.Title: Great shots
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was reasonably priced, took great pictures easily and was simple to use. Bingo, this is a bullseye. I also loved the change with the SD Card. It is slightly raised above the platform that houses it so that I don't ruin my manicure trying to pry it out of the camera.  Lightweight, well designed.  Only one thing on my wish list ~ that someone would invent a case that is humidity and temperature controlled so that I won't have to worry about leaving it in the car, RV or taking it out in adverse weather. Otherwise this camera is a definite 5.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: RFM
Reviews.Content: Exactly what my family needed. My kids use this camera a LOT. Easy to use, yet offers a lot of features.

Reviews.Title: Light Easy to Use Camera
Reviews.Author: HelenRuth Burch
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures, is light, easy to use and is exactly what I was looking for travel.

Reviews.Title: Canon 1400
Reviews.Author: SUE STEVENSON
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera...fits nicely in a pocket and with the view finder plus the LCD screen ...just be careful how deep a pocket you put it in because it is so small can get lost down in there.

Reviews.Title: I Love this camera...w/ reasonable price...
Reviews.Author: Ira-1
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd "Canon" camera...the 1st one is the Ixus, and this time I tried w/ the AA battery...it's very easy to find the battery and it has the view finder too...

Reviews.Title: Best camara for easy shot
Reviews.Author: tamaki
Reviews.Content: I believe the functions of PowerShot. Also PowerShot A 1400 is reasonable price and easy for taking photos. This is one of best camera for anybody.

Reviews.Title: A1400 digital camera
Reviews.Author: moe
Reviews.Content: a great camera for the price. very easy to run  and set-up, it is light weight and I like the fact that nit has a viewfinder at the top.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: EJaros
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera for on the go.  Images turn out pretty good, video however, don't bother, images are very choppy.  Unless you set it on a tripod, but other than that video is useless.  Not to mention you'll love the (270) page user guide.  A bit overkill.

Reviews.Title: Canon Poweshot camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon M. Ellis
Reviews.Content: The only problem I have with this camera is that it cuts off too soon.  I will be taking a picture and it cuts off so I have to reset the zoom again and take quickly.  I may be doing something wrong but not sure.  I like the pictures but it also takes a long time to download to my computer.  It does take clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1400 16 MP camera.
Reviews.Author: A. D. Poyner
Reviews.Content: The A1400 seems excellent, But Canon as a company leaves some to be desired,  The package includes a one page "getting started" sheet which also instructs you to download a PDF manual.  The camera also requires a USB cable for several functions.  Manufacturers (including Canon) have bastardized the USB standard by putting various connectors on their products. In this case different from the previous Canon A series that I own.  I finally found one - the fifth in my collection of USB cables. It would not hurt to include a "starter" memory card, for anyone who does not have any.NOW, WHY THE HELL can't Canon include a hardcopy manual (small) and a cable (also small) with the camera?Seems like they are behaving like Apple.  Good luck with that!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Pictures look great.. Zoom works wonderful for closeups.. No downside to this camera that Ive found so far.. Love it!

Reviews.Title: For the price this camera is great
Reviews.Author: Lori L. Sampedro
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and compact...perfect for traveling.  Fits great in the pockets of your pants.  Using 2 AA batteries makes it convienent for not having to be around a USB port to charge it up.  Zoom feature and pixel size are perfect for this type of camera.  The pricing is great compared to other cameras with the same features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Emily Keck
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I really like that it takes regular batteries instead of a certain kind. I took it on my honeymoon and when the batteries started to go I just went to a store and bought new ones. The picture quality is also good. I took it on cave tours and was impressed with how well the pictures turned out.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Will Cosban
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend for her summer travels this year. She absolutely loves it. Its simple so even a child can use it, takes great pictures (16MP is crazy good for a camera this size) batteries seem to be lasting a long time. All in all a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Really great camera, the zoom is great and it takes beautiful pictures, anyone looking for a low cost camera I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Zugmeister
