The dial for shooting modes is gone, Everything must be setwith a navigation scheme. Shot 260 pix on vacation and went thru 4 batteries, it eats them! I downloaded the 200 page manual and learned how to use the P mode. This is great for shooting in low light, I used the flash only once. With the 20X zoom and the ISO set at 400 you can get shots extremely close. The camera has more features than an amateur will ever need. I never used the video mode so can't comment. Over all it's a good point and shoot camera, just don't pay more than $85.

Reviews.Title: Nota good camera
Reviews.Author: P. Mistretta "Phillip2167"
Reviews.Content: I should have looked at this cameras features before I bought it. I don't buy a camera that does not have some form of optical image stabilization. This camera has a cheap form of image stabilization which is near useless! The camera takes three shots and combines them for a "blur free" picture. I went out on a sunny day and snapped dozens of photos using this feature and NOT ONE was sharp or clear. But I wanted to give this camera a decent try before posting a review telling other people to look elsewhere for a camera,don't buy this one! I went out and used no zoom no digital zoom just a standard wide angle on a sunny day. For a 16mp camera these photos were grainy like 1600 Asa film. This camera fails big time in all areas. And I am no amateur. I have had camera since I was nine. I have a Nikon coolpix p90 and a canon powershot SX10 IS, and a kodak easyshare Z1085 iS. Photos from the easyshare Z1085IS which is only 10mp looks a hundred times sharper than this camera. I don't recommend camera. And I cannot understand how so many can claim it takes good photographs?? My advice if you want sharp photographs the camera must have optical image stabilization. Don't go for digital image stabilization it's cheap and it doesn't work

Reviews.Title: Decent Little Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Hanna "There is nothing more enjoyable tha...
Reviews.Content: The Pros:I love the 16 mega pixel photo quality and 720p video quality of this little camera.  It costs about a quarter of the price that I paid for my camcorder back in 2008, which only took 8 megapixel pictures.  The thinness of this camera is ideal, which makes it easy to take this camera with you on the go.  The videos I have uploaded to YouTube do not have the static noise my old camera made, so this is a plus.  I also liked that it came with batteries, which gives me a bit of time before I go out and buy rechargeable AA batteries.  I highly recommend purchasing rechargeable batteries because this will save you money in the long run.The Cons:One reviewer said you can take the memory card out of the camera and stick it in your computer to upload the pictures, but I have several reservations about this. Plugging a USB cord into the camera to upload the pictures is actually easier than opening up the camera to pull out the memory card, and then opening the slot to stick it in the computer. The memory card made my computer freeze up as the pictures were uploading, which might be because my laptop is from 2009, but it still was a hassle. The camera really should have came with a USB connection cord, but thankfully I have one.  People who are not as tech savvy will have a difficulty with this issue, and I would never make the assumption as a manufacturer everyone can figure out how to upload the pictures without a manual, which brings me to the next issue.  Its seems a little on the cheap side not to include a manual, and to tell the user to go download it from the manufacturer's website.  I have not done that because it is an extra step, and these directions are assuming that everyone who purchases this camera has an Internet connection.  So people might have to go to a library or a cafe to use the WiFi, and do they want to spend the time to download the manual?  I was able to figure out the basic functions of the camera without doing that, but if it means raising the price of the camera by a few dollars to include a USB cord and manual, I actually think it might be helpful.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture
Reviews.Author: Jamie M Boyd
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife (she loves pictures).She was VERY dissatisfied with it and had to return.Has pore picture quality and flash is SLOW.DID NOT met expectations from other reviews.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just love my new camera. There I was in Athens and I couldn't see on my older camera or my tablet with the strong sun. Another tourist told me she had a camera with a normal viewfinder. I looked all over and most cameras with both kind of viewfinders were big and expensive. This is small and takes wonderful photos. It didn't come with a case and didn't fit my small case for the old Lumix but it fit right into an old mouse case I had. I also love that I won't need to take a special charger, just some AA batteries which are found all over the world.  I haven't learned all of the features yet but will be traveling soon so will have to explore all of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Oh Dear, a little camera that works and has an EVF
Reviews.Author: M. Hale
Reviews.Content: Yes folks, it's just a digital camera.  You can't send pictures via WIFi to your computer or your smartphone, tsk tsk...also you can't imbed the fact that you are in the jungle at such and such lat and long with a GPS app that saps your battery.  But if you need a second or third camera and a compact one that works and you can tolerate mostly AUTO, this is a keeper.  It's small, looks much better than I thought it would, uses AA batteries - I have rechargeable so but it comes with a couple of starter batteries.  For $85, what's not to like.  The EVF is small, but useable, and horrors this means you can even use this little camera in sun light.  What will they think of next?  I agree, a few cirques are true.  After flash, it's a bit slow to recharge. It's not a camera that gives you 800 ISO for low light.  But it fits very easily in a pocket or a purse, and it's not bizarrely over engineered like the Panasonic I just bought that's basically charming but useless for it's presumed main purpose...taking pictures, the ZS 30 at 3+ times the price.

Reviews.Title: Viewfinder not easy to use plus package included no software disc.
Reviews.Author: Disappointed Grandparent
Reviews.Content: The viewfinder, reason for buying the A1400, is too small to easily use.  For occasional use it might be adequate but description doesn't quite add up to field use.  Indoor application probably is a better use as opposed to use outdoors.  Lack of software disc was totally a surprise and its' availability online not a good option.

Reviews.Title: Only small and inexpensive camera with a viewfinder!!!
Reviews.Author: Joy Ingham
Reviews.Content: I've only been using it for a couple of months, but I purchased it because it had a view finder. IT seems to be the ONLY small camera on the market that has one.  And I was tired of finding myself shooting blind with my other camera in bright sun because I couldn't see what I was aiming at.  And for my purposes, it works very well.  And the photo quality is certainly adequate (I mean if you want a really great photo - spend a few hundred bucks.)

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money.
Reviews.Author: jonjay
Reviews.Content: Camera performs as well as can be expected for the price.  Like the viewer feature which does not require you to look at a digital image for framing.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: It's an awesome point and shoot camera, and my wife and I love it. We weren't looking for something professional, we just wanted a good camera that would capture our memories well. Takes really good pictures - especially outside. We absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: Thank goodness for the viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: So far, so good.  I love having the viewfinder.  I am an armature.  My photos seem a little grainy but maybe with knowledge I can change some settings.  I only use the basic settings.  The close up setting turns out beautiful and the camera makes that selection automatically when you place the camera very close to the subject.  Before I found this camera. There didn't seem to be any other camera in this price range with the viewfinder.  I also like using regular batteries.  The camera gives plenty of warning before the batteries are completely gone.  I will edit my review as I use the camera more. Thanks to others who take the time to review.  I looked at what you had to say.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Norman C. Jamieson
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera with an optical viewfinder and readily obtainable AA batteries.  This one fits the bill perfectly, although I would have preferred a more powerful zoom.With even the best screens my wife and I find it difficult to see scenes in detail on bright sunny days at a beach.  Also, we travel widely and I always have four rechargeable batteries on hand.  However, I also like the fact that essentially anywhere in the world one can find AA batteries in an emergency.

Reviews.Title: Just got it today.  No USB cable
Reviews.Author: Oregonian101
Reviews.Content: I ordered the camera from Amazon on July 5 and received it today.  Excellent shipping time.I did not pre-order the USB cable, Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS USB Cable - USB Computer Cord for PowerShot SD1400 IS because I just couldn't believe that a camera would ship without it.  I understand not sending a memory card, but, a USB Cable?  Well, there wasn't one, so, will be ordering that shortly.Costco has a great sale on the SanDisk Extreme Class 10 memory card.  I got the 16gb since I don't take that many pictures or videos.  So, I'm looking forward to seeing how the speed works.  The read/write speed is reported to be 45mb.Anyway, I will write more when I've started using the camera.  I just wanted people to know that the USB really isn't shipped with the camera.I only put 3 stars due to no USB cable.  I'll update that when I start using the camera.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed.
Reviews.Author: Laurie A. Morfe "Laurie"
Reviews.Content: I've owned 2 previous Canon Powershots, both Elph versions, and I loved them. My last one stopped working last summer so I purchased this camera based on the Amazon reviews. It takes FOREVER to get the shot because the minute you try to snap the shot, it says "flash charging". I miss the picture practically every time. While I do have a Nikon DSLR, which is hands down my favorite camera, it's not practical to carry around with me. I love having a point & shoot to just throw in my purse. I will definitely spend a little more $$ and do a little more research before buying my next one.

Reviews.Title: No, no, no!
Reviews.Author: Noah S.
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon fan for many, many years. I have, and still use, a Canon 35mm SLR and my old Canon PowerShot A520 has traveled all over the world with me. Having said that, I must also say that the A1400 is a pathetic device. The only feature that works well is the viewfinder, which was one of the reasons that I bought this camera. It is made of such flimsy material that I was almost afraid to even pick it up lest I somehow break it. The time between shots is so long that were you to take several photos of your puppy it would look like time-lapse as the dog grew! I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Lousy pictures
Reviews.Author: Erik Bergethon
Reviews.Content: This camera has more pixels than my Powershot Elph 100HS (16 as cmpared to 12.12 mp) but the pictures are fuzzier than my Elph. Beware of $100 cameras! I can see the main problem is the tiny lens (is it glass or plastic?). We returned this and bought a Nikon Coolpix S9300 which is twice the price but ten times the camera because of the bigger glass lens and sharper pictures.

Reviews.Title: overexposure failure
Reviews.Author: David L. Gross "Wanderer"
Reviews.Content: My girl friend  bought  this  camera  for  me  knowing  my  preference  in the past  for  Canon optical  viewfinders and AA batteries. Unfortunately while  on  a  trip where  replacement  was impossible the thing began  to overexpose in  snapshot mode and no adventuring  in  its program  subfolders  could  stop the  problem. Movie mode  remained  ok so......I have  a movie  camera going  back  for  repair/replacement. On the other hand I give  Canon  credit  for having a  very  responsive  customer  contact  staff. Tune in later for the  outcome.

Reviews.Title: They tried to make it smart -- and now it is unhelpful and hard to use.
Reviews.Author: MARY K WALTER
Reviews.Content: I owned an earlier version of this camera which I loved. I HATE this version. Focusing is impossible and switching between modes at will is obnoxious. Very disappointed. I want a camera with batteries I can change readily so that is why I tried this one. FAILURE

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made, not worth the price
Reviews.Author: KLR
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale but it was still a $70 camera so I thought it would be pretty nice. The last camera I bought was $40 and was much nicer than this one.  80% of the pictures it took came out blurry and it sometimes took 10 to 15 seconds to actually take the shot which sometimes made me miss what I was trying to take a picture of. It has very few settings and its will sit for a few seconds saying its "charging the flash". For how cheaply made this camera is it should have been priced at $20. Highly disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: An optical viewfinder is difficult to find in any compact camera.  Although the zoom is only 5x, the camera takes beautiful pictures with superb detail.  I was able to take close ups of several small items, something I wasn't able to do with a digital SLR that cost nearly ten times as much as the A1400.  The A1400 is simply fun to use.  For the price Amazon is charging, you also get the great benefit of having a 16 mega pixel camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Constance M. Bennett
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  My daughter got one and advised me to get one too.  I need it to document my quilts.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: lynstey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for when I don't want the weight of my SLR and when the weather could damage it. Great photos. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1400
Reviews.Author: katherine emerson
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed that manual not included.  Would pay more if necessary to cover cost  of manual.  Camera functions are a bittricky and it would have been nice to refer to a paper manual.Cumbersome to have to go online for info and print what I need.  Far easier to receive the manual with the camera.

Reviews.Title: great little point & shoot camera from canon
Reviews.Author: pjc in h.b. "pjc"
Reviews.Content: replaced my powershot A1200 with the A1400 recently and like it so far.  really like the palm-sized body for "grab shots" when using my full size DSLRs are not practical or desirable (like last summer in an open market in Tanzania where taking pics of the people is an automatic $1 "transaction" per shot.  also like the black body for being even more inconspicuous .

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: PGG
Reviews.Content: Exceeds the capabilities of the Olympus we've had for years and is much easier to use. really a user freindly camera

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Joel A. Campbell "JACampbell"
Reviews.Content: Works great. Like others have mentioned you occasionally have to wait for the flash. If THIS is the case buy another camera. Otherwise, takes great shots. Easy to use. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money
Reviews.Author: SeaGoddess2403
Reviews.Content: I wanted something relatively inexpensive to take casual photos. This little Canon fits the bill. It uses regular AA batteries which, while a power hog, allows you to get new batteries anywhere you are.The only issues with it that I have encountered is that the flash is a bit laggy, and takes some time to "recharge" between taking pictures, and the fact that when it's on, the screen goes black so quickly when in camera mode.Overall, I like this camera and it was worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value
Reviews.Author: W
Reviews.Content: Surprising clarity of pictures. Camera does everything well at a very modest price. Good idea to order the cable as well.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: sam the motor man
Reviews.Content: Excellant value and a great Mother's Day present.My wife was very pleased with the features of this handy camera. It fits her purse nicely and does everything she wanted in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing doesn't begin to describe this thing
Reviews.Author: BGE
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, my...you know.  Not compared to my last camera, anyway. It was a Christmas present, and six months later I'm still trying to figure it out. It came with no manual. The onboard help feature doesn't offer answers to any of my question, and I can't find the manual for it on line. The zoom feature is way blurry, a problem I never had with my Samsung camera. The flash takes forever to charge. It eats batteries, and always seems to fail when I have a great photo op. I used to love taking pictures, and carried my camera everywhere I went. But not this thing. Hate it, hate it, hate it.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Mamaw
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this camera.  I wasn't sure at first because the screen to view live picture was not real sharp.  But, once I had the pictures printed they were sharp.  I love that it has a blink detection.

Reviews.Title: A1400
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: A easy to operate camera with a fair price, by far a great value.But thats all I want to say!

Reviews.Title: nice little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Kandis Renstrom
Reviews.Content: my experance with it is about the same as others. you want a quick point and shoot that is easy to carry this one works. the view finder is easy to track with. takes nice wide view distence shots  and farly nice close ups. it has enough settings to keep you guessing. but the in camaria help is easy to use and it's always with you.  there is a lot of noise if your trying to crop up. the vido came across nicly with decent auto. me I can't understand why this is the only small canon with a few finder. but thats marketing today.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: kimberly m. stanton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just because I like taking pictures that look nice! It takes great pictures and how can you beat that for only $58

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: V. Pierson
Reviews.Content: I gave my girlfriend this camera for Christmas as her Kodak broke. She wanted something simple that would take decent photos she could print, and she had no computer. I have 3 Canons myself and always pleased with them. While I was showing her how to set it up, I found it had many features my current ones didn't, such as 16MP photos, 5X zoom etc. So I bought a 2nd one for myself and WOW, so much power in such a little device. What impressed me most was the HD video. It will be my shirt-pocket pal for quite awhile. The price and the free 8GB card were both bonuses. I was disappointed with the lack of instructions so went to my favorite manual printer, manualsink.com and purchased a 124 page copy. I am a frequent customer of theirs and very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price.
Reviews.Author: RICHARD HAMERSLEY
Reviews.Content: My wife really liked it.  It's small so she can carry it with her most of the time and it uses readily available AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for the fish eye effect.  It was a good price on Amazon so it wasn't that much more than a fish eye filter.  The camera has a bit of texture feel to the plastic and a metal tripod mount.  It is packaged cheaply from Canon as there is no computer cord or manual.  They just give a start up paper that gives a web site where you can download a manual.  If you know digital cameras the manual isn't a big deal but to a novice it could be a big help.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Michael Probstein
Reviews.Content: Not only is this camera easy to use, it is smaller than the previous A1200 model that it replaced.  It fits in the A1200 case. The A1200 was a tight fit in this case, and it fell out of the case and got damaged.

Reviews.Title: Great camera BUT no memory card included
Reviews.Author: John C. Demos
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera BUT it didn't come with a memory card so you can't use it out of the box.  Other than that, it is very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera BUT it doesn't come with a memory card
Reviews.Author: Carrah Demos
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent but it doesn't come with a memory card so you can't use it "out of the box."  Other than that it is easy to use and very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners
Reviews.Author: Trendy Shopper
Reviews.Content: I recommend this camera to anyone who likes taking photos.Also,it is very affordable.There are a lot of nice effects as well.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: James F. Williams
Reviews.Content: The best thing I like about the camera is the view finder. Takes good pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon still has the viewfinder!  Also AA battery power.
Reviews.Author: Richard A L Rames
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it much, but it is similar in function to my previous (Canon) camera.  I appreciate the viewfinder, the AA battery power (I use rechargeables and always keep a spare set with the camera) and the SD card.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jkhinch"
Reviews.Content: Its Ok. It does feel flimsy like some other reviewers have said; but I don't fault it for that considering its price.What I don't like is:* something about the design makes it challenging to hold steady* Shutter delay* Delay to charge flash

Reviews.Title: My Disneyland Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Littlewolf
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good camera for our trip to Disneyland over Christmas break.  I looked on Amazon and I found it.  Just the right size to.  Easy to carry around on our trip.

Reviews.Title: Great for Outside Pictures
Reviews.Author: Byron Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: We all have had the problem of trying to take outside photos in bright sunlight where the focusing screen gets washed out and unusable.  The optical viewer on this camera allows the picture taker to actually point and shoot on subjects in the bright sunlight. The quality of the pictures is quite good and the size allows you to drop it into a shirt pocket and forget about it.  The use of standard batteries is also a big plus when traveling and not always having access to a power point to recharge a rechargeable internal battery. The only con I have is that when you take a series of flash pictures the recycle time is relatively long and the shutter delay is excessive.  This is an excellent camera for someone wanting to take outside pictures while traveling and for its price, it is a great buy. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Lovin this camea.
Reviews.Author: E. Shanks
Reviews.Content: I been taking pictures and movies with it I love the camera and vidoe camea works wonderfully. I am bummed about one thing no flash for night videos. I was trying to record my nephew and my son playing in the dark, couldn'tsee vid and hade to delete.

Reviews.Title: love this camera .. for a point and shoot camera its great .
Reviews.Author: shawn
Reviews.Content: Settings like no other. And its fool proof but yet great for a more experienced person.. clear pictures plug and play setup on pc  highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: OK But Not Great for Photo Booth in the Basement
Reviews.Author: MainelyClassics
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to primarily use for taking pictures for online selling. I did the research. Yes, it will mount on a tripod. I understand that it feels a little cheap. But the price was right.My picture-taking setup is in the (chilly) basement and our photo box or booth is lit by fluorescent bulbs. I am having two issues the the camera that both turn out to be normal operating parameters. It is going through batteries rather quickly. That is due to cooler operating temperatures. And the screen image flickers, almost enough to be a migraine trigger for me. That, according to the manual, is an expected effect of the fluorescent lighting. Go figure. I really thought that the camera was defective...I am letting you know in case you had the same plans for this camera.

Reviews.Title: decent litle camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Camera is light weight, takes fairly decent pictures, and feels well made. I don't care for how the menus/setting are arranged, nor for how long it takes the flash to charge. But for the price it was a deal to me, as the person it is for has a dinosaur Kodak easy share. I was a bit upset that when it says 8G SD card free when bought from Amazon.. You have to go through special steps to get that free card. I didn't realize this until I didn't find the SD card until I logged on to double check the item posting. Should have been wearing my glasses to see that smaller print I guess.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Nikon Cool Pix-my phone takes better pictures
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Thompson
Reviews.Content: Im not satisfied with this camera. My phone takes better pictures. I'm going to return it. I have a Nikon Cool Pix that is old but the Nikon is still better. The Canon also feels cheap like it would break easily.

Reviews.Title: For the price of $69.99 not bad..
Reviews.Author: roaeja "Hey you!"
Reviews.Content: I brought this for the price, hopping for the best and getting better!  For the price, a good deal..Can select  resolution, guess it's at 16mb?  Was surprised about the zoom>>>out to 20X!Using Eyefi card in it.  Seems to work ok.  Pictures are ok for price you get.  Little fuzzy.Having shot any outside, NO SUN, way up north.  Low light sense, sucks.

Reviews.Title: USB cord not included
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Came on time but no USB cable came with it. I checked the FAQ and it said they came with the USB cord, but I did not get one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. Inserted the two AA batteries (included), a couple of minor settings and start taking pictures. The picture quality looks good (for the price) and the focus feature is nice. The only reason I am giving it a 4 rating is because it did not include an USB cable.

Reviews.Title: good litte  replacement
Reviews.Author: michael a brown
Reviews.Content: got it as a replacement for my Kodak EasyShare Z1485 IS Digital Camera  i been using for years like fact its bare bones point an shout to go along with my Canon EOS T3i good for fast shot nice bit of sating for fast use  were you cant get the big DSLR out also can take the 32GB SD cards as will adds  to the canon hardware i have

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: William Newmiller
Reviews.Content: Sale quick and easy. Delivery also very good.Like the camera. Easy to hold and point and shot.Can't wait to use on our 10 night cruise to the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: HELP! With a Question - Is there a Macro View?
Reviews.Author: James B. Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this but I don't see anything about a Macro setting for super close ups? I will get it only with that as one of the options that I will use a lot! A lot of the other settings are clutter to me. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: A huge step back for the Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: John Cocktoeson "Frank Drebin"
Reviews.Content: I always loved the Canon PowerShot series that took two, AA batteries.  They were a good size, high quality, made of metal and inexpensive.  Plus, batteries were easy to find and I didn't have to carry a wall charger with me.This new version, while a little smaller, feels like it's made of cheap, lightweight plastic.  It's lens movement is slower and less responsive.  It's video is of poor quality and the operation is sluggish and awkward/difficult to do quickly.  I am very displeased with the direction in which Canon has gone.  I have two different, previous versions which I still use today and will continue to use.  I guess this new camera would be ok for a kid, as others have said in review.  I am so, so, so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Know ahead what to expect
Reviews.Author: Martin Siegel
Reviews.Content: This is a PROVISIONAL review since I just bought this camera. It may be great and I intend to get back with more comments on how the camera performs. This is about what to expect.I got a great price from Amazon and have absolutely no complaints in that regard. I bought this model because I needed a camera with more pixels than the one I already own, an eight megapixel Canon A590. This A590 camera has been outstanding. Ironically, it now sells for more than three times what I purchased it for. This seems unique! The only reason I can make is that Canon stopped making the model and there is still demand. My hope is that the A1400 serves equally well.Regardless of what reviewers say concerning how easy a digital camera is to use, I think there are so many features that it is imperative to have a print manual on hand, particularly at the outset. The Canon A590 came with one. That was NOT the case with the A1400. Although a manual was not listed as coming with the camera, it was my mistake to think of it as pro forma. To get a .PDF version, a Canon Web address was given but was useless since no connection could be made. At one point it was listed as a danger to my computer!I did a search for the A1400 manual in .PDF, finding one through Ask.com. I downloaded it (120+ pages), but in so doing I omitted to check a box. This near fatal flaw led to my home page getting hi-jacked by Ask. This is a common problem as I discovered and no easy thing to correct. Firefox has a whole load of complaints with this same lament, along with myriad suggestions to get rid of hated Ask.com ... which may or may not work. I found one on YouTube and it did work; all kinds of wasted time and aggravation.The .PDF manual is for TWO cameras not one. How cheap can Canon get?! Once downloaded it is easy to read, no better or worse than others. NO PRINT version can be obtained. In my view this is a major omission. In parallel, I recently upgraded my cell phone. The manual for it is 179+ pages. You have to go through a few hoops to get a print version, but I did get one. My son-in-law says all companies are going the non-print route. If so, it is hateful in my opinion. Canon could get tons of PR goodwill if a print manual was in the offing, a possibly big advantage over the competition; even if the manual is for two, three or four cameras.I don't agree with reviewers who say this camera is "easy to use." All kinds of signs and symbols come up which are different than the A590 and, for all that, may make this new model better. However, it's a waste of time and aggravating to fiddle around and have no resort other than a computer.On first impressions, I like the way it looks and feels in my hands, and especially the fact that it uses AA batteries. Unless there is no consumer choice in the matter, I'd never buy a camera that uses litheum batteries. The size of the LCD screen on the A1400 is the nearly identical to the A590, with maybe the new one being a tad brighter. Too much is made of the LCD screen. I have a friend whose camera has a dynamite LCD screen, the best I've seen to date, but the camera's actual pictures are so-so.I will get back later about how this camera performs, perhaps with a comparison to the older Canon.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Coradi
Reviews.Content: Having owned (and still owning) a number of Canon "pocket" type cameras (all the way back to the A700 and similar models), I expected this to be a decent pocket (literally, this time) shooter.  Sadly, I am not terribly happy with it, the only concession being it was at a giveaway price ($60).The only redeeming features (note I did not say "qualities") aside from the price are the optical viewfinder (yes, you can acually LOOK through the camera to set up a shot) and it's use of off-the-shelf batteries (AA).  Okay, the screen is a good size for a pocket cam, but that's about where it ends.Pictures are not great, but will do as long as you have plenty of light.  Make a note:  More megapixels DOES NOT necessarily mean higher quality photos!  Nothing is truer than with this camera.  I would take one of my old, clunky, "low" megapixel Canons over a dozen of this model any day.  But thats not as much an issue as USING this thing.Finding settings in the annoying on-screen menu takes forever, as opposed to past models with wheels or buttons for critical functions that you want to access and use quickly.  If you're under, say, 25 and don't mind an Xbox controller-like experience to get to the functions you want -- scrolling and selecting and all the other fun things that go along with navigating menus -- maybe you'll have a ball putting this to use.If you just want something to set on "auto" and shoot away with reckless abandon, or need something you can put at risk of getting broken, lost, or stolen, then pick one of these up as either a backup or just basic snapshots (beach vacations come to mind).  Beyond that, spend some more money and get something better.  Whether or not that's a Canon, I cannot say, as the only Canon I have gotten lately is an SLR which is fine.  Luckily, a couple of my older but slightly larger and much heavier pocket Canon's are still going and I will appreciate them SO much more after using this marginal camera.

Reviews.Title: Not like my otherpowershots
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "leneker"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to get a more modern powershot that still had a viewfinder.  I was hoping to get an upgrade from my 540 and 1000 models.  I didn't.This camera just doesn't mange to keep up with my picture taking needs.  I have tried to use faster cards and lower compression and most fully charged batteries, but I can't get the pictures to come out as sharp as with my other cameras.  There is a great delay while the flash charges and the camera seems to take forever to right to the the card.I find myself always reaching for the outdated model rather than this one.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: addndan
Reviews.Content: Was not what we were looking for and there was this annoying delay when taking pictures. I didn't like it

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Marv F
Reviews.Content: Update 12/24/2013I've had this camera for a couple of months and can now say that this is THE WORST camera I've ever used (and I've been into photography for over 50 years). It just takes a lousy picture - 80% are out of focus indoors or outdoors. Don't waste your money on this camera!I would not normally purchase this level of camera. However, my other camera failed and I needed a "quick and dirty" cheap replacement and it had a viewfinder.(which I find essential for outdoor shooting).  As other reviewers have noted; the focus is very soft and the flash takes forever to recharge.I would have rated it 3 stars, however, I also suspect that the camera (Sold on Amazon by Tri State Camera) was an "Open Box" item, as it was not sealed and did not come with a warranty card.

Reviews.Title: Problems are not with the camera
Reviews.Author: JOANN MCCORMICK
Reviews.Content: I specifically picked this camera because I wanted the viewfinder. The camera does an excellent job, but you have to download the 300 page instruction booklet. The one page guide included in the box is so basic as to be insulting. At least you can print only the pages you'll need. And I really resent that I had to go buy a cable to connect the camera to my computer. Cable from previous Canon did not fit. Yes, it's true that the cable was not listed as part of the contents, and I'm guilty of  not reading thoroughly. But I'm still annoyed at Canon's cheapness.

Reviews.Title: Tough to take good pics
Reviews.Author: LT Jasper
Reviews.Content: The delay on this camera is too long. I take a lot of low light shots and this camera not great or that even though the specs said it was

Reviews.Title: Versatile and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: M. Kolbert "Heavy reader"
Reviews.Content: Has many features which make photography much easier.  Not sophisticated enough for aficionados but an very high powered and compact point and shoot camera.  I particularly like the eye level view finder.

Reviews.Title: Great camera perfect for capturing quick photos without having to change any settings.
Reviews.Author: Janette
Reviews.Content: The viewfinder and stabilizer are wonderful. You can now see what you are taking a photo off when it is sunny out and you don't have to worry about camera settings. Great camera to take anywhere.

Reviews.Title: I thought it would take a better picture
Reviews.Author: readsalot
Reviews.Content: I need to be more discerning of "deals" sent to me by Amazon.  I  bought the camera because my wife likes a viewfinderin a camera and her old kodac died.  Picture quality is just fair in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Debra Pugh
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to take pictures of my son's graduation from Naval Power School and some sight seeing while there.  Some pictures come out great and others don't.  When using zoom, the pictures tend to be blurry.  I've also had the viewer on the back of the camera go blank when I'm zooming, forcing me to use the regular view finder.  Not at all happy with this purchase.  I've used the camera a couple times since, like at a bridal shower, and found the pics of anyone moving instead of standing still to pose for pictures, were also blurry.  The reason I bought this particular camera is that I wanted a point and shoot camera that didn't require me to manually focus what I was shooting, and I wanted to be able to zoom in and take pictures.  This camera doesn't do either well.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality not the best.
Reviews.Author: Lee W
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot A1400 camera I purchased is acceptable for snapshots but I have several low-cost cameras in the past with sharper images.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat disappointed in this camera.  The resolution is not that good and the pixels show grainy in low light - not even dark.

Reviews.Title: Takes FOREVER for the flash to charge between pictures
Reviews.Author: Kat3hy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes average pictures.  If you want any kind of action shots, or even if you want to take more than one picture of something, this is NOT the camera for you.  The flash takes a long time to ready between shots.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: zinger
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother and she is very happy with it. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. For the price a good deal. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that I suspect the mini usb port on her camera may be defective. I went thru a fair amount of time downloading software and trying different cables but couldn't get the pictures to download to her computer. I finally decided I couldn't spend any more time on it and set her up with a card reader. Having a view finder is a great feature and one that is getting harder and harder to find. The only other comment isn't really negative as this is the case with most cameras today but who needs 16 mega pixels? Inspite of all the above I would still recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Tina Julich
Reviews.Content: I have always respected the Canon name for cameras and was looking forward to having one, even if it is a lower-end camera. I was so disappointed in the quality of the pictures that I returned it within a couple of weeks. The final reason I decided to send it back was when I tried to view a video on my computer and it was totally blurred. One video was fine, the next one like looking through a piece of plastic.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Admin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for office use. So far, we have not had to use it. However, it seems to be a good camera. It took me a while to find all the functions, since there are not many buttons on the body of the camera. All we really need is a simple point and shoot anyways. If you do not need any special functions, then this is a good camera for your needs. VERY basic. Yet, money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Awesom!e
Reviews.Author: ellice m jibas
Reviews.Content: Thanks for this wonderful product, though it is kind of much consuming batteries, while the images, and videos are very off quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with a couple of flaws
Reviews.Author: Eusebius
Reviews.Content: I need a simple, small, lightweight camera to take in to the field with me and the Canon Powershot A1400 certainly fits the bill.It was a relief to find a good optical viewfinder in a simple point & shoot camera like this since most manufacturers are phasing them out. What's even better, it's more than just a viewfinder: I can go into `live' mode and see exactly how the scene will be recorded instead of just on the digital display screen.PICTURE QUALITY is NOT the absolute best. Unless there is plenty of light, the pictures tend to be a little `noisy' with light artifacts showing up. If I was using this camera as a regular point & shoot I would be very annoyed. A regular Smartphone takes much clearer and better photos under these circumstances.BATTERY LIFE is good. The two AA batteries seem to last longer than in previous PowerShot versions and this is a big improvement. For instance, the A1100 uses batteries at twice the rate compared to this A1400. The newer versions of this camera (A2500) use a proprietary rechargeable battery but it's much easier for me to pack two spare AA batteries than buy and keep charged a spare A2500 proprietary rechargeable.FLASH RECOVERY TIME is pretty quick at about 1.5 seconds and has posed no problems for me. I don't expect the recovery time to be as fast as a full fledged DSLR, and the time really is acceptable.SIZE perfect for a small hand-held and it easily fits into a shirt pocket with room to spare and the weight is incredibly light.There are two BIG drawbacks to this camera:- First, the 300 page user manual is available on-line for download only. No printed copy is available unless you print it yourself. I cannot fathom why Canon would issue a manual this large and why they would not make a concise printed copy available.- All the shooting modes and selectable settings are not easily available or intuitive. For some reason Canon has done away with simple selections on a knob and buried them in the software where you have to scroll through menus and make multiple selections to find them. This is not good.Generally it really fits my needs for a very small, lightweight camera to document animal tracks and make short visual recordings of wildlife. But for general snapshot photos it may be better to find a simpler camera that takes better quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: wilfred greenwood
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift and it was loved. Just as described, would buy again basic features that i was looking for and for a great price.

Reviews.Title: battery hog
Reviews.Author: Mamma to 3
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine but it really eats through the double A batteries.  I would consider a rechargeable battery next time.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Terri Elzey
Reviews.Content: I do not like this camera, its battery operated and drains batteries way too fast.  The shutter is slow and the pictures are not that clear.  I was not impressed with this camera and quality of Cannon is just not there in this one!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For Fishing Trips -- Carry AA Batteries easier than recharging a battery.
Reviews.Author: Hayden C.
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use.  The sight through the eye piece is much easier to use in sunlight than the screen on the back.  The instructions are extensive and easy to read and apply.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great photos
Reviews.Author: WM L EAGEN
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot camera, it is very light weight and easy to use.  When I set the camera to mute and no flash, it held that setting until I changed it even though I turned the camera off and on. The zoom is easy to use.  The viewing screen is a nce size.  The photos I have taken so far, have turned out great.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Anatoli
Reviews.Content: very good pictures, very durable, gentle with the batteries(simple AA last forever), I'm using it with rechargeable,- very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the $$
Reviews.Author: pepper pot
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great pictures.  Some controls are in the area of your thumb when holding to click picture, accidentally press,have to stop and clear screen. Pictures are sharp, clear, easy to review or delete, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: great if you are on a budget
Reviews.Author: Deidre
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for anything fancy so I grabbed this little camera for a good deal to take on a vacation and capture my memories. It did what I wanted it to! I love the viewfinder for taking pictures of bright days on the beach when it is a little more difficult to see the screen. I really like that this is a 16 mp camera.. it's a nice upgrade from my last 8 mp one.The only complaints that I have are:-The menu is a little weird to navigate and I have never had that issue with any other budget point and shoots I've bought-It does not take good lowlight/ night time pictures. I used the flash at night on the beach and the pictures came out just terrible  (but the daytime ones were great and looked great on my computer screen when i uploaded them.)-The shell is plastic so I'm not sure how durable it will be in the long run but haven't had a single problem with that yet.All in all if you just want a cheap camera that does the job and has a viewfinder I think this is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: Slow to CHARGE FLASH -- WHAT?!
Reviews.Author: C. Floro "crf"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera.  My powershot elph was stolen.  This does not have the features. I wanted.  I can't play with the exposures at all.  Plus when I use the flash, I can't take one picture after another.  It takes about 4 seconds to CHARGE THE FLASH.  WHY?  That's ridiculous. I want to return this camera simply for that reason.

Reviews.Title: View finder so helpful
Reviews.Author: Susan "Love historical fiction, mystery, susp...
Reviews.Content: This camera has a good old fashioned view finder that makes taking pictures in bright sunshine easy.Easy to insert memory card in printer and upload pics.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for grab and go
Reviews.Author: Dave Ellison "truth teller"
Reviews.Content: The camera is a great size for carrying everywhere. No, it's not something a National Geographic photographer would rely on full time, but it comes in very handy when dimensions and weight are important. Photos come out fine in the auto mode, although its functions can be easily customized for a variety of lighting situations. I particularly like the fact that it has a viewfinder since I'm most used to shooting that way. I also like that the display at the back can be turned off when using just the viewfinder. Don't know yet how much of a battery pirate it is; it takes 2 alkaline AA which are easy to install. Unfortunately, though, there is no battery level display, so keep a spare set close by. Supposedly, though, an on-screen icon or message indicates when barrereis are nearly depleted. Overall, the A1400 is pretty user-friendly. I probably will purchase a waterproof case for when I take it kayaking. One major complaint: Included instructions are woefully incomplete. I had to go to Canon's website to find a comprehensive manual, which I downloaded -- took a lot of time, ;ink and 123 sheets of paper. Bummer!!! At purchase I also was led to believe a USB cable was included. It was not. Amazon, however, sold me one and did not charge for shipping it. Owners also need to purchase a memory card. I got a Transcend 16GB SDHC Flash care and am pleased with it so far. I also bought a Case Logic DBC-302 soft case for added protection when the camera is not in use. It fits the A1400 perfectly, and there's also a pocket for extra batteries. I definitely would recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Perritt "t-six"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a 10 year old Kodak as a second camera.  Took it to Alaska and got some great pics and videos.  Zoom is adequate and the pictures are sharp.

Reviews.Title: I Take It Everywhere
Reviews.Author: Veronica McNamara
Reviews.Content: Easy to use if you are not a 'techie'.  The pictures are sharp and clear and it almost fits in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: One can't operate the features intuitively like I did on my SONY Cybershoot
Reviews.Author: Lynne Shapiro
Reviews.Content: It takes a good photo and the zoom works well but now I have to download a PDF file and study up this and that to set the features and the like. With the SONY, I just learned so quickly what to do without reading any manual

Reviews.Title: Flimsy camera; downloads a problem
Reviews.Author: Anne M. Drowns
Reviews.Content: This camera is made with cheap, lightweight plastics, and does not seem as though it will last more than a few months. The battery must be replaced often, which is a problem when the cap for the battery chamber is flimsy and difficult to align. Worst of all, the software for downloading the pictures is pretty awful, and after several hours trying to work it out, we're still not finding success. Will perhaps give it another hour of our time, but this camera will very likely be returned.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1400
Reviews.Author: Barrie Robinson "Barrie Robinson"
Reviews.Content: Lost my Canon S200 so I bought an A1400.  It was cheap and its quality reflected that.  Would have bought a more expensive one but optical viewers are scarce - and LCD are a joke if you are off your couch!!!!  But the big nag I have is that nowhere on the Alcatraz type packaging does it say that one needs a memory card.  When I drove back 50km and complained to the salesmen he said such little beauties have not come with cameras since 2009 - and I am meant to know that?  But in the specifications it gives memory cards but does not say one does not come in the box.  Having solved that problem I had to return AGAIN to the store because there was no USB cable in the box.  Admittedly it did say it had a USB port but other items nearly always come with what you need to use.  So why supply batteries which are obtainable virtually anywhere when memory & cables are not so easy to buy at ones local convenience store.  So the phrase "use it out of the box" can not be applied to his little glob of frustration. Next time I buy a Canon I will get the salesman to demonstrate it working before my very eyes. The camera (not Canon) I bought for my daughter had everything included.  By the way I would love to get another S200 - so Canon do you have any languishing in your back shelves in the stock room ??This added a little later!  I tried to get a "USB" cable.  The nearest Source people did not have one, the Japan Camera people did not have one.  So I returned to Walmart assuming that if they sold the A1400 to me they would have the cable - but NO.  So I gave them all the packaging back with the confounded Canon unusable piece of modern marketing rubbish and got my money back - but not the mileage on my car !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Dropped my good Nikon camera and was out of a camera until I got another one or got mine repaired. Thought it would be a good idea to get a small, portable, all around camera, that can be taken anywhere and that fits in your pocket, and that I could also use in the meantime. I liked it because it still has an optical viewfinder, and also has 16 MegaPixels.  Not so, ... Big disappointment. The "Optical Viewfinder" does zoom in and out as you use the zoom, but the image you get is totally OFF from the image you saw and took a picture off.  So, ... the Optical Viewfinder is absolutely NO GOOD !!! The regular images and pictures you take, even some in broad daylight, are completely grainy and very "noisy", as well as also a bit unsharp. You can't blow up any pictures to anything bigger than maybe an 8 x 10 or even think about using a cropped image to enlarge it. You see this right on the computer screen. Also, there is a control button for the Flash, but only to turn it OFF or to turn it on AUTO, ... NO way to turn it to ALWAYS ON, like if you want to use it as a fill flash or in backlit situations. It is a small and cute camera, but if you want any halfway decent results, get something else. I ended up returning it after just a few test shots. I still don't understand why they even bothered to put 16 MP into a camera that gives you worse results than any of the older 2 or 3 MP cameras, or even my Phone Camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Carolene Knapp
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband on my first order and was so impressed with the quality of pictures and video I had to order me one.  I haven't used mine yet since I already have a working camera and I have been no where to take pictures.  The shipping was fast and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: I love having a view finder!
Reviews.Author: Linda Brock
Reviews.Content: A view finder in bright light is a must for me. Now I can see exactly what I'm taking a picture of. Takes great pictures; is compact and light weight.

Reviews.Title: Instructions
Reviews.Author: Ivory Trader "ivory trader"
Reviews.Content: Why is it such a stretch for Canon and everyone else to PRINT a manual that doesn't send you flying from page to page?  See page 33 for more info on....." In what tech universe does that concept ever make sense.  And it's too complicated to use or understand.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: T. Wilber
Reviews.Content: If you are using this outside it should be fine, but it's really bad in low light and will result in super noisy pictures.

Reviews.Title: It makes my pictures look good.
Reviews.Author: Kansas reader
Reviews.Content: I am new to picture taking, and this little camera makes me and my pictures look good!.  It was just the right price for a new "camera bug" to get started with and it has been easy to use.  The manual is huge (I kept a downloaded copy on my computer)  and I refer to it often and I still have alot to learn, but I believe learning on this is the way to go before spending more on a "fancier" camera.  If I become really really good, I may progress to something bigger and better but if I just stay with this, I know I made a good buy. It is easy to load your pictures on line and send to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1400
Reviews.Author: S. Reeder
Reviews.Content: Good camera for my husband who wants simple controls, AA batteries so we don't worry about trying to charge in the middle of the day and lightweight.  Also helps that it takes good pictures!  It is getting harder and harder to find cameras that still take AA batteries, so I buy them when I can.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joanne A Strauss
Reviews.Content: This is a very sturdy usable camera, The menu is a bit confusing especialy because they didn't include a manual.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it looks.
Reviews.Author: Wilma Hume
Reviews.Content: This camera was VERY small. Didn't fell comfortable even in my small hands. It's plastic case made it feel cheap. Be aware there is no image stabilization. I over looked that in the online information. The support person said (she was very nice!) you have to just hold the shutter button half way til it is focused then depress it completely to take the photo. Had to be extremely careful or I got blurry photos. Just didn't work for me. I returned it for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend to my friends.
Reviews.Author: Jeffry Johnson
Reviews.Content: Thought this would be an upgrade to my 8 year old Olympic but was not. Have taken over 35 pictures w/no keepers

Reviews.Title: SIMPLE AS CAN BE
Reviews.Author: Dok Won
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, it's her first digital product. Couldn't be easier for a beginner.Takes great pictures. Preview button for pictures is a nice feature.Nice size, good price.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot A1400
Reviews.Author: Lucy G
Reviews.Content: my first disappointment was taking it out the the shipping case: no protective cover for the camera no instructions (yes instructions are on line, all zillion pages of disclaimers etc.)the flash takes too long to load/charge making it impossible to shoot quickly.while shooting the camera switched to some unknown mode which made replay and download of the pictures impossible.I will return it!

Reviews.Title: good camera but still disappointed
Reviews.Author: JA "Spirit"
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that the SD card was in the same place as the batteries...inconvenient..I always have to be careful that the batteries don't fall out when I take my card out.  Great that it has a view finder but, where it is placed... if you use it, it leaves nose prints on your viewing screen.  I thought I would like the fact that it uses regular AA batteries-they can be replaced quickly-no need to wait for the battery to recharge... but, if I take a picture using the flash, I can't take another picture until the flash recharges-I get a "busy" note on the camera.  I can imagine I'll be missing some very great once-in-a -lifetime photo shots because the camera is "busy".

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Frank in KY
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  I like to take a camera when I go out hiking and this is perfect.  Small enough to fit in my pocket, very easy to use, long battery life and the picture quality is very good.  So far all the pictures I've taken with this camera have been great.And I like that it runs on standard batteries, I can always carry spare batteries.  It does not have an included usb cable but that is not a minus for me since I have four already.My only gripe is that the case is plastic, a metal case would have been better.

Reviews.Title: This product is not as once would expect.
Reviews.Author: Ezequiel Gomez
Reviews.Content: I chose thi rate for I was not very happy with the product. I think it is pretty expensive for not having the memory or even a power cord to pass the pics to the computer

Reviews.Title: Awful camera and worse instructions.  Do not buy it.
Reviews.Author: Cologodan
Reviews.Content: I selected this because of past happy experiences with Canon cameras and because of the optical viewfinder and AA batteries.  It is flimsy.  The controls are not intuitive.  The flash is very slow to charge.  It eats batteries.  But none of these failures, bad as they are, approaches the absolutely incompetent instructions - the worst I have ever encountered for any electronic product.  With all of its functional shortcomings, the camera might work for some limited purposes, but Canon has made learning to use it a nearly-maddening problem.  There is no paper manual with the camera.  The supplied disc defeated my best efforts to render it into Word.  When I found the manual on the website, it was in PDF and more than 200 pages. The index was obviously compiled by a machine, not by a human who might understand how other humans would look things up.  Once a desired page is found, the layout is wasteful and the text is in Engineer-speak, not English.  After very much more work than a point and shoot camera should ever require, I finally found and printed enough pertinent pages to work out how to use the features I need.  I'll keep it until it breaks.  I believe (and almost hope) it will break soon, so I can put this thing behind me and buy a competent camera.  But it will not be another Canon - not ever again.

Reviews.Title: cannon over Kodak
Reviews.Author: Edwin Johnston
Reviews.Content: because Cannon has always been a good buy, have a Kodak 300 and picture is no0t that grate and it will not function at times.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1400
Reviews.Author: Rev Dale D Connell
Reviews.Content: I trust Canon fully. They are known for their quality workmanship and production. I would purchase no other product but Canon.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this one
Reviews.Author: michael miskill
Reviews.Content: Simply cannot get a decent picture with this - poor resolution.My cell phone camera is much better than this

Reviews.Title: Slow on response time and horrible video format
Reviews.Author: Rick "Zoo guy"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera with a viewfinder as my current little nikon is very difficult to see the screen in bright light. I like the AA battery option except it's slow to recycle after a photo. I can live with that but it is annoying. The "shutter" speed is quite slow so if you're taking a photo of anything even moving a bit, good luck. Have a new puppy and can't get a good clear photo even when she's sitting and starring at me. The worst feature is the Quick Time video format. What a giant pain in the butt to get it converted to a format where you can edit and make movies. More software to load on my PC which then insists on being the default software for any videos. It does take good photos and video, seems to be solidly built and is priced ok. Next time I have to be much more careful and make sure the video format is AVI. I recommend looking elsewhere for a small digital camera, but then cameras with veiw finders are a rare breed. Next time I guess I'll have to give up on that feature.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: Raymond  G.H
Reviews.Content: This camera is a toy. It is almost impossible to take pictures with it because for some strange reason, after one shot, the screen shows that  the flash is charging... And this does not stop until, out of frustration, you turn off the camera. Don't buy it!

Reviews.Title: Flash charge is AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Fowler "frecklesinside"
Reviews.Content: I'm sending this camera back. The pictures are OK, blurry at times, but pretty much what I expected for the price. The AA battery feature isn't as cool as you'd think since it sucked the batteries dead in just one day. That is not sustainable for me. The camera feels pretty cheap, but worst of all, the flash charge between pictures is ATROCIOUS!! I was trying to take pictures of my fast moving one year old on her birthday (the reason I bought this camera now), and the flash would take 10 seconds to charge between pictures. She'd be done and gone by the time I could take a picture.Again, I'm returning this. Don't waste your time with it. I think I'll spend a bit more and get something of much higher quality.

Reviews.Title: hedline
Reviews.Author: N A Parker
Reviews.Content: Not as expected. Regular batteries did not work. Rechargeables not included. Pictures viewed were landscape and could not figure out how to change. It will have to do until I can afford something else.

Reviews.Title: i don't like it
Reviews.Author: Janet Wallace

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon A1400 is a fun camera available in many colors. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that I think many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the lay of the land.The A1400 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16 resolution (megapixels), and a x5 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.It has a viewfinder, which most in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 1600. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 230,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The weight of the camera is a convenient 135 grams.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Good for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Flat_Tire
Reviews.Content: It's light and compact.  It can take pictures in many different situations.  The autofocus and autoexposure features are sophisticated and make snapshots easy.  It has a viewfinder: if you're shooting in bright daylight the viewfinder is a huge benefit.There are some things you can't do.  For instance you can't set the aperture size to adjust the depth of field.  And you can't set the shutter speed to adjust for whether the subject is moving.  Instead, Canon has given us some low-value features: super-vivid colors, poster-effect, fish-eye, miniature model, toy camera (vignetting), and monochrome.  These effects can be managed better by editing the pictures on a computer--that is, assuming you'd want them.Some of the advanced features require more dexterity than I have.  You have to hold the shutter button in the half-down position while you press some other button and then push the shutter button down the rest of the way while you're aiming the camera.  Also, you have to remember which button has which effect.  Or make a crib sheet to carry with you.  It makes me wonder if they field tested this thing.What's annoying is that it will stop taking pictures and notify you that the batteries are low when they still have a lot of charge in them.  I had the same problem with another Canon point-and-shoot so maybe it's just something about Canons.  So you need to carry a spare pair of batteries.  After the batteries have a few hours of rest they'll be good to go for a while.  When they just don't work anymore you can still use them in other gadgets till they really are used up.  Rechargeable batteries don't work because they don't charge up to the same voltage as alkaline batteries.It's handy because of its compactness.  You can carry it any time you're out and about: chances are you'll get an interesting picture or two.  And the quality of the pictures greatly exceeds what you can get from a cell phone.
