I can't even touch the tiny little buttons on the camera. perhaps it should be listed as a little ladies camera and definitely not, for old farts, with huge  restricted hands. thanks Rod Garnett

Reviews.Title: I did not get the memory card t
Reviews.Author: m
Reviews.Content: this did not come with the free memory card that was advertised as being part of my purchase of this camera.Furious there is no way to speak to someone directly about this.

Reviews.Title: Decent temporary camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I ordered this because of a one-day deal right before Christmas.  Combining the sale price and a gift card I had, I think I paid around $20-30 for it, which is great because otherwise I would be very disappointed.  The camera uses 2 AA batteries rather than charging by plugging into the wall.  There are sometimes significant delays in between being able to snap a picture because it says it is charging the flash.  By significant, I mean up to 3-5 seconds in between being able to take a picture.  That obviously causes some issues when trying to capture that special candid moment when my pups or my niece do something funny or cute.  The picture is also not the greatest - the color is not very crisp and some of them come out fuzzy.On the positive side, I will say this thing seems extremely durable.  I've broken two other cameras of this size in the past 3 years.  This one seems much more sturdy than those two.I only purchased this camera because I didn't want to go through Christmas and New Year's without one.  I always intended for it to be a temporary solution because I am planning on upgrading to a nice SLR - just not quite ready to splurge for it yet.I would recommend this camera for younger folks (teens or early adults) because of its durability.

Reviews.Title: OK camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Aspen
Reviews.Content: This little camera is fairly decent.  It is VERY easy to use. Lack of features a downside. Wish it had bluetooth to connect to a computer automatically.  Does not come with a computer transfer cable.  On the plus and down side is the need for AA batteries.  Some times that can be a benefit (when you don't have time to charge to get more batteries), and you don't have to worry about loosing your battery or your charger.  On the negative side is the extra cost to power the device, and that the charge takes a long time to turn back on.  Multiple pictures in a row does not seem possible.  The good part of the camera is that it takes good pictures in low light setting.  When using the flash you can almost white people out.  The image stabilization is a big bonus (especially for someone who has slight tremors.  The biggest boon for this camera is the HD video camera with definition up to 1280p. You have an excellent video camera, that can also take pictures.

Reviews.Title: PROBABLY A GOOD DEAL FOR SOME BUT NOT FOR ME
Reviews.Author: Peter D. Noyes
Reviews.Content: This camera has a smaller viewing screen than I favor plus the wire cord linking it to my computer had to be added at the time I placed the order.  The cord is different than cords provided for use with my other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Mixed results
Reviews.Author: Ramp builder
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced a Canon Powershot 590IS which malfunctioned after 4 years of use.The new camera takes great pictures and is easy to use.  Much better menu and help functions than my previous Canon.  I like the ability to use AA batteries and I like the optical viewfinder.  The Canon 590IS had an optical image stabilization feature which worked great.  The A1400 has a digital image stabilization system which apparently works by taking multiple shots and picking the best.  In actual use this is worthless since camera movement typically appears in all the multiple shots.  It cost $100 (from Canon) to have my old camera repaired vs $85 for the new one so I got the new one even though I was very happy with the 590IS.  If I had realized how much I used the image stabilization I probably would have had my older camera repaired.  I wish there was a version of the A1400 with optical image stabilization as I really like the other features of the new camera (better, easier to use menus, on camera help, more megapixels).

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1400 is easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Susan Bergman
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera.  It is easy for an inexperienced person to use.  Liked the viewfinder in the blazing sun.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: John A. Nugent Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera met or exceeded all my expectations.  It is compact, light, and easy to use. The fact that it uses aa batteries was an important factor for me, because they are readily available & easily replaced. The screen is large & bright.  Price was below $100.

Reviews.Title: Just what we were looking for.
Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small camera with an eye piece as well as a screen because it is often very difficult to view the subject on the screen on a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Little Camera
Reviews.Author: edstrelow  do not buy This app does not open ...
Reviews.Content: I saw one that my wife had bought for high school journalism and had to have one. It takes great pictures, sure not up to bigger cameras but not that far off either. I don't understand some of the critical comments such as poor pictures in low light.  I just finished  a set in a museum that didn't allow flash and they were fine. As regards the flash, I counted 5 seconds to recharge and take another picture. I consider that acceptable. With any camera you need to watch the battery usage. Turn down the LED display or better yet use the viewfinder and allow time for the batteries to tecover or carry extra batteries for All in all a great supplemental camera which may be all that some people will require.

Reviews.Title: Powershot A1400
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I inadvertently panned this product, intending to pan a different product I purchased. I eagerly rescind my complaint and consider the camera purchase entirely satisfactory. It was my error.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Nancy "nallienan"
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of pictures, literally thousands upon thousands in a years time. I have the Powershot SX130, but the shutter began to stick on occasion, so I purchased the A1400 to get me by until I could save for a professional model. The features that got my attention were the use of regular double A batteries, the viewfinder, video and 16mp. I am somewhat disappointed in the graininess of low-light shots, especially if they are action shots, but in good light conditions action shots, even without a tripod are no problem. Portraits, still life and macro pics are superb, crisp, and the colors are very vivid. The auto program is wonderful and seasoned photographers shouldn't shy away from it. The quality of pictures excel over my older sx130, but the zoom isn't nearly as good. Some were complaining of depth of field, although it won't be as deep as the pro cameras, it can be achieved somewhat in macro or portrait mode. I found that the shutter speed in continuous shooting is adequate and the focus doesn't change if one is tracking the object with a fairly steady hand. Overall, for the price, I think this camera does a fantastic job and exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: very good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: T.A.Turner
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that I could used in a hurry. At my age I want to record vacation memories. I was not looking for a camera to take professional photos. I am very well pleased with the Canon Powershot A100. Though surprised at how small it is, its size was an asset, easily fitting into pockets and purse. The AA battery life was very good and 2 AA batteries are easy to find and carry as backup. It has a view finder as well as a digital screen, and the photos are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Magnolia Benitez
Reviews.Content: Shipping was efficient. Great product for such a good price. I purchased a 32g, 45mb SD Card and it works well with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Shipley
Reviews.Content: I am not very techie and I can handle this camera just fine.  It makes good pictures.  It seems very sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Big Performance for a small price.
Reviews.Author: D. Nate
Reviews.Content: I got this one to replace my old Nikon that got broke during a trip to Germany.  At first the Camera felt cheap but it grew on me. The more I use this camera, the more I liked it.  Set up was extremely easy and straight forward. Now sure there is a better cameras out there but not at this price range in my honest opinion.  Yes, I don't use it but Eye-Fi is supported. http://support.eye.fi/cameras/canon/powershot_a1400I was going to give it one less star for not coming with a USB cable or any Cables for that matter.  But it made up for this because its mini USB input is none-proprietary, yes that's right standard.  One of the cables for my USB 2.0 scan disk card reader worked Perfectly.  Then to top it off, the Camera was quickly recognized by my DIY-er computer with Windows 8 and my wife's HP Windows 7 Lap Top. I like the view finder. Improvements? 6 or 7x zoom and yes cables but shortcomings/cons are very minimal.

Reviews.Title: A simple camera that also has an optical viewfinder. Ideal for people using reading glasses.
Reviews.Author: D. Nestegard
Reviews.Content: When you get older, those so and so view screens, no matter how large, are a pain. They wash out in sunlight and we seniors must put on our reading glasses to even view them. Finally someone came out with a lower end camera with an optical finder! The camera is for my wife who wanted a simple to operate camera with reasonable picture quality. This was it and for only $79, a steal in my experience. We highly recommend this for anyone wanting a compact, versatile, and dependable camera for those "snapshots".

Reviews.Title: brilliant little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Mullis "southern girl"
Reviews.Content: easy to use, easy to download pix with a usb cable or simply pull the SD card, excellent quality pix.  Love the viewfinder, love the fact it uses AA batteries, love the zoom, love the video capability.  Took it on a trip to France, and came home with excellent pix.  THANKS for a top quality little camera.  Bought a caribiner clip camera bag that fits it perfectly, and the camera hangs from my purse.  Easy peasy....

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: facesoblue
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter's birthday. I was surprised when we opened the box at how plastic it felt. Her other camera was metal, sturdier, and felt more substantial. This felt flimsy.  My daughter says the pictures are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera -Required viewfinder.
Reviews.Author: david p lopath
Reviews.Content: great camera.  It's the only decent camera with a viewfinder.  A requirement for us.  Old school and very accustomed to SLR's .  This camera is a "pocket" back-up and id a replacement for an old Cannon A520 which is now a little unreliable.  These small and relatively inexpensive Cannon cameras are almost bullet-proof.  One question --  Why so few cameras with a viewfinder ??---Dave

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: james backus
Reviews.Content: I have not had a lot of exp w/digital cameras but the one thing I have found is that it don't seem as user friendly as some others I had borrowed. There is not much of a Manuel with it but Cannon will send you a hard one on request if you call. That bad thing about any manual on line is ya never seem to have access when ya want to look something up. I don't think the manual is all that well written either as when you trying to get the camera to do something and push the buttons like the manual sais there is always something else they don't tell ya or assume you should know to do. I can get pretty frustrating.The camera does seem to take good pics though. I got it mainly to take pics of things close up for details to have for records like tools, guns, and other things of value for insurance purposes as well as just gen. use. If I would have had time and access, I would like to have been able to get familiar w/ some other models/brands first, but I didn't and bought it on cust svc. recomenation.

Reviews.Title: Fits in a pocket
Reviews.Author: Andrew Robertson
Reviews.Content: I just wanted something to record hikes and so on. Homemade porn if the opportunity comes around. It will serve in either case.I'm not Consumer Reports. Anyway, if you want to be Ansel Adams may need to drop more bucks. Or be a war photographer. If you want to do that you would better served spending way more money on a shrink.It takes fine photos. I could use less menu options. Same reason I don't want a smart phone. I want to take a picture. I want to make a phone call. I am not revolving my life around gadgets.

Reviews.Title: not very nice
Reviews.Author: Ayman Chabbah
Reviews.Content: this item uses batteries, not electrical power.it's smaller then its picture shows.the quality of the picture is not nice especially in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Junk Pure and Simple
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. Hughes "Steveo"
Reviews.Content: Junk, pure and simple, Grainy pictures at best, Built like a child's toy! I would not waste your money!! Buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Terrific little camera!
Reviews.Author: ALONDRA47 "alondra47"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it yet, I am going to Guadalajara soon and I will use it there.  I'll give you full report after that.

Reviews.Title: slow
Reviews.Author: Superchallenger
Reviews.Content: This camera is super slow! Looks good and it works if your taking pictures of things that are not moving.

Reviews.Title: might be good for money
Reviews.Author: M. Shultz "live music is better"
Reviews.Content: I suppose this is what you pay for.  Wanted see through view finder and got it.  But the camera feels very cheap.  I had a30 and thought this would be similar.  It is a big step down.

Reviews.Title: not as advertised
Reviews.Author: P. Kay Bryan
Reviews.Content: the camera did not have all the accesories that was needed for full operation ie disc, cable to download, instructions, itc.

Reviews.Title: Camera Completely stopped working
Reviews.Author: Dontrell Connor
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend buying this camera. When the camera arrived it seemed to work fine and abruptly when I was on vacation in Atlantis Paradise Island I went to turn on the camera and nothing. Camera now doesn't even turn on. I initially thought it was the batteries so I replaced them and it still doesn't work. I received this camera last week and now it doesn't even work. Due to me being on vacation and around water I took extra precaution to make sure that it didn't come in contact with any water or that I didn't accidentally drop the camera. I was so disappointed in this camera. Do not buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Cheap camera
Reviews.Author: James Amos
Reviews.Content: Camera takes dark pictures.  Better pictures without flash.  Flash pictures are either too bright or very dark. Not an easy point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good buy good price!
Reviews.Author: richard josselyn
Reviews.Content: Good camera, takes good pics for a good price! I had the 1300 but it got stolen which I wrote a more detailed review. I choose this camera because of all the good reviews I read about it.

Reviews.Title: My son love it!
Reviews.Author: Pan Dongsheng
Reviews.Content: I bought this little camera for my 5 years boy, he love it.I am so glad that I still can find good camera which fit by traditional AA battery. So convenient.

Reviews.Title: Durability
Reviews.Author: helen scott
Reviews.Content: The only concern I have is it's durability. I use this in my job frequently and need it to hold up. Only time will tell but I hope I get at least 4-5 years out of it.

Reviews.Title: Poor construction
Reviews.Author: lindac.hyatt
Reviews.Content: cheap construction.not as many options as the 1200.Good news is it takes ok pixI was promised a rebate on this purchase

Reviews.Title: Very Unsatisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Lyn Syvrrson
Reviews.Content: Buyers beware, The ad for this item says that if you purchase this camera you will recieve a Sandisk 8GB Memory Card however when my camera showed up there was nothing in the box with the camera so i was screwed out of what they were selling. Dont like working with companies that false advertise or mislead you!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jk
Reviews.Content: Terrible quality pictures. Very grainy and seems cheaply made. You're better off spending a bit more for better quality. I would not recommend this camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to put in my laptop.
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: I saw a reveiw where you were asked if there was a cord to go in a laptop, and you responded YES. I never got the cord.

Reviews.Title: STINKER
Reviews.Author: Palvinder S. Sandhu
Reviews.Content: Worst camera you will ever buy. Cheap plastic. Alkaline batteries...Very bad. Stay Away as far as you can. Fair Warning.

Reviews.Title: No macro automatically or macro button.
Reviews.Author: MJCJ
Reviews.Content: This camera does not automatically adjust to Macro and the macro button is not convenient on the back of the camera to switch to it easily.  My old PowerShot adjust automatically, and I was just buying this one as back up since it was so reasonably priced, but will be returning it.  Also, takes a while for the flash to charge.  This camera is very inexpensive, extremely light weight and compact, and may work fine for pictures with plenty of lighting and not needing macro, it just does not fit my use.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Ellery Green
Reviews.Content: The camera satisfies my needs, is relatively easy to use and light weight.The view finder makes it useful when conditions make the screen difficult to read. The telephoto produces good, crisp images. Learning how to obtain the correct focus took some patience. My needs are simple, so I haven't used all of the features available. I'm not sure how long the batteries will last. Perhaps I should carry a spare pair as a backup. Practice was required before I successfully discovered how to view recorded photos and to transfer them to my computer. The primary reason for purchasing this model was my frustration with the lack of a viewfinder on my Panasonic Lumix. The dials and buttons on the Lumix are more easily disturbed when carried in a pocket. The Lumix is also much heavier. The pictures obtained on both cameras are about the same in quality. I do like the rechargeable battery in the Lumix.

Reviews.Title: great pics - bought it for my husband and he loves it.  We took it to Sweden and Norway and Iceland.  Happy!
Reviews.Author: Julie Thompson
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband and he loves it.  We took it to Sweden and Norway and Iceland.  Happy with our pics.

Reviews.Title: USB Cable not included? Seriously?
Reviews.Author: me "none of yo bidness"
Reviews.Content: Does not include USB cable. Does not include AV out cables. Both of these were included with previous versions of the PowerShot Axxx line of cameras.Does not include memory card, not even a small starter card.I have liked Canon cameras from the past days, but this is getting ridiculous. Give people enough to get started and to use their photos.Not including the memory card I kind of get. But no cable is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera.
Reviews.Author: Lily Serene "Lily"
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a small, light camera that would take good pictures and not much else. I don't want lots of features, just inexpensive decent photos. And a viewfinder.  Guess I learned my lesson.  The viewfinder is next to useless and the photos are such poor quality.  After reading so many rave reviews, I was really surprised to see the photos that weren't at all sharp, and so poor compared to my other cameras.  I give it 2 stars because it does work, and is light and nice looking.  However, I'm returning this.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera, feels cheap
Reviews.Author: Youi
Reviews.Content: As technology continues its growth and need to beat its predecessors, however this model went back in time. It feels very cheap and made with low quality materials. As for the picture it takes; it's okay. Nothing great, but I suppose that is what you should expect from a $110 camera.

Reviews.Title: Total Garbage -- Needs More Light than in an Operating Room
Reviews.Author: C. James
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I find a product so utterly useless for the intended purpose. I just wanted something to take pictures mostly inside and when the pictures are not fuzzy they are washed out with the flash. The only time it works as one might expect is on bright sunny days outside to take pictures you might with the phone camera, the rest are grainy, fuzzy, and just not worth bothering.It also blows through batteries like nothing I have ever seen.This was an impulse buy, so this is on me. It now lives in a drawer and my old old 4MP is back on the job and doing better than this ever will.

Reviews.Title: a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Lynn Chang
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this camera. I know it is cheap but expected it shoot good photos out door with good lighting after reading other reviews, but the one I have does not shoot good photos at all.

Reviews.Title: The PITS
Reviews.Author: Bill Hay
Reviews.Content: This camera is the pits. I have yet to figured out how to take pictures with it. There were not instructions telling me how to operate it in a simplified form.I finally found a notation on the packaging to the 228 page instruction manual could be download on Canon web site. Which id in such fine print I need to use a magnifying glass along with my normal reading glasses.To be honest if I had retained the original packing materials this Camera can with I would have returned it for credit.

Reviews.Title: good camera but not best price
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: I used this camera before take a Canon PowerShot ELPH 320 HS. If this is the first camera for you, you will think this is the best. Yes, the quality of the images is good. But if you know more about other products of Canon, you can see many change. I found much convenience in Canon PowerShot ELPH 320 HS. Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: I was looking for easy. This camera is still technical. I had all kinds of stuff displayed on the screen that I did not understand. There is a 129 page manual you can download and read, or print. I took my new camera to a wedding and after 40 pictures and video, the camera lens would not retract when I chose to shut it off. Needless to say I returned it and got a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Ashley Ghaith
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE product. I returned it almost immediately after setting it up. I know it is a cheap camera, but it wasn't even worth the $90. It has no memory so you must have a memory card to save a picture. The photos always came out very dark. The only decent thing about it was the zoom, but even that isn't worth keeping it.

Reviews.Title: It is a cheap camera
Reviews.Author: parker
Reviews.Content: so you get exactly what you pay for!their is no cable for data transfer to your PC.Thank you.

Reviews.Content: Came with no usb cable for computer upload or any mention of it in there add, plus no software to make it all work except another web site that wants to charge you  $4.00 to down load it to your computer. What a rip off !!--Amazon used to be on top of things like this,Oh well looks like all things go to the dogs eventualy or corprate profits for bonuses.-- Wont be Fooled again.JJ Pryce

Reviews.Title: How much can we NOT include in a camera?
Reviews.Author: Capt. McPl0x
Reviews.Content: I was glad that I opened this camera before  I left before my trip because 1) There is NO MEMORY card included, and 2) there is no USB cable to get the pictures off the camera.This is an insult to customers every where.

Reviews.Title: WHAT AN AMAZON RIP-OFF!
Reviews.Author: prodale "jprofx1"
Reviews.Content: AMAZON OWES ME THE 8G SD CARD!  No where in the initial description of the item for sale did it make clear that we had to also go in and click on the SD card itself in order to get the SD card free!!!!When I got the camera, of course, NO SD CARD! so I go back and then CAREFULLY read the info, including clicking the SD Free Card offer and only THEN do I find I was supposed to separately place this item into the cart to buy at same time!!!!!!!!Why wasn't the damned SD card just included automatically so we didn't have to do anything to get it???? That is what I was expecting!!!! I WANT MY SD CARD!

Reviews.Title: buy camera, camera parts not included
Reviews.Author: Bruce Stanforth
Reviews.Content: buy a camera except camera parts not included. And so far have not been able to return for a refund

Reviews.Title: Unknown camera
Reviews.Author: David C "badgerstate2"
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I don't own this camera. Mine is a Canon PowerShot SX10IS. Now that one is a nice camera. So I don't know what to say about the A1400. I am wondering why Amazon wants me to review a camera that I never purchased.
